review:
I was going to give these seeds a 3-star rating until I realized, they're not good enough to order again. I'm sure I don't want them again so I'm closer to "I don't like" than "OK".

The good:
The salt content IS pretty good. On par with how we season our own.
They're crisp.

The bad:
Seeds are pretty small which means the ratio between seed and shell is not great.
Small seeds means you almost can't shell them, you HAVE to eat the shells.
Too many seeds have a sour taste which ruins the hole experience.
Per ounce they're more expensive than any others I've tried.

I wish David's Seeds put out a lighter sea salt version. Their seeds are much larger so you can peel the shells if you want. They just have too much salt. I remember eating the Indian brand when I was a kid. They had a great tasting seed but unfortunately even more salt than Davids.

This is a nice smooth coffee, a part of the Keurig K-cup portfolio. This is labelled "extra bold." Not sure that that is the case. This has a nice smooth, albeit rather mild (and even bland) flavor.

However, some K-cups have a harsh, almost acidic, quality to them and are not particularly pleasant. This produces a nice cup of coffee.

I order this pearl sugar to make liege waffle.
I looked up other Belgian pearl sugar too but it was way to big granulate.
This sugar has just right size and amount for my waffle.
I definitely will order again later when I need it.

Used these in a waffle recipe that said they would dissolve and make air pockets that had some sweetness, resulting in a light, crispy waffle.  They did not dissolve but became burned clusters that got stuck to the waffle iron grids.  The waffles were like lead, were sickening sweet and basically the worst ones I've ever eaten.  I certainly would not recommend this Pearl Sugar to anyone.

Mayonnaise is an interesting product, cool, smooth and creamy it's the lush counter partner of the low cal mustard but it's of those things people think they don't like until they taste it in the proper way and that's all it takes for a secret love affair with luxe sauces and recipes that can be made with it to start.

I am a big fan of sandwiches and any new way I can spruce them up, especially with nice sauces and spices is always at the top of my new ideas to make for lunch or to fill into an interesting menu on the weekends. The Rouille is spicy, that I deducted just from looking at the angry orange color in the jar, the color of auburn harvest on a stormy night. The taste is of cream immersed in a sea of chili peppers and garlic with a peppery background. My favorite way to eat it is in a sandwich with a leftover cold coconut breaded chicken cutlet with some crisp romaine in between two toasted crusty slices of bread smeared on the inner sides with the Rouille spicy mayonnaise . The taste is a tropical rendition of a Caesar Chicken Sandwich I get at Hale and Hearty here in NYC but much easier since I made it at home and it took no effort.

Great on bread, meat or as a condiment to any afternoon snack or smeared on some California roll for a spicy finish. There is no end to the amount of uses this product provides.

- Kasia S.

Barry Farms is known for their quality and rare, hard-to-find ingredients. Xanthan Gum is no exception, but anything can be found on Amazon, right? Barry Farms to the rescue!

Xanthan Gum is used to modify the viscosity of liquids, on a very low scale (typically 1/3 tsp per 1 gallon). Because of the difficulty in combining Xanthan Gum to a liquid evenly, you should mix this into your liquid very slowly, in a blender at full speed, and it should be one of your steps (before adding other ingredients, including Guar Gum).

Many ice creams and popsicles, even Italian ices, call for two main ingredients: Xanthan Gum and sometimes Guar Gum (also available from Barry Farms: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00015UC5M?tag=a52-20&ie=UTF8). Both of these gums behave quite differently, and Xanthan Gum can be harder to mix into your liquid solution (again, mix in slowly via blender running on high), but both are effective means to preventing crystallization of liquids, which is the secret to making softer ice cream and popsicles instead of rock hard ice!

Another interesting characteristic of Xanthan Gum is its ability to thin out when subjected to forces such as shaking (called shearing), which makes it great for poured sauces, as it will thicken back up after having exited the bottle. It can also prevent oils from separating from liquid-oil emulsions (think salad dressing). It is also more stable under a wider range of temperatures and pH than other gums.

Xanthan Gum can also be used to give dough the stickiness that is needed in gluten-free baking, as gluten is usually what gives that sticky characteristic to dough. And no matter the use, Xanthan Gum will always remain colorless and flavorless, so it can be used for just about any need that suits it.
Well, that says it all...add some to anything as a thickener / tiny bit - works wonders.  Fast delivery from family run farm/store (nice folks) - average pricing.

Was very happy to find this at such a resonable price and I am sure it will a very good product.  The unfortunate part is they seem to charge shipping according to the price of an item, not the weight.  By the time you add up shipping and price of the xanthan gum you will pay the same anywhere.  Not a savings!

The Xanthan Gum works great as a thickening agent when cooking hot meals or even smoothies in the blender.  It takes the place of corn starch or flour when I am making a stew.  I've tried buying this product at health food stores but could only find it on Amazon.  A tiny bit goes a long way, so even though the bag is small, it will last a long time.
I used this product to make my own lubricant, and it works wonders.  I'm not sure what else it's used for, but it makes great lube!
It works great for gluten free flour. I was able to make 100% Spelt bread because of this product. I can't complain.
I bought this online because it was much cheaper than in my local health-food store.  Then I got slapped with a $7 shipping charge!  For a teeny envelope of product!  I'll buy from the store, thanks.

This baby food was really thick and my baby wouldn't eat it.  Every other stage 2 food that I've gotten may have been a bit thicker, but this was really very thick, nearly the consistency of regular mashed potatoes, it also seemed very paste like.  All the other food I've gotten from Sprout has been fantastic!

These are great tasting and while they aren't good for you per se, they are much healthier than most brands. They are fresh tasting and crunchy. My only complaint would be that the chips are small, not too many good sized ones in bag. The smaller 1.5oz bags were better as they stay fresher better. I will buy these again.

I ordered 3 bottles to give it an honest try because I didn't think one bottle would give me enough time to honestly review it. One bottle lasts approximately 15 days. I just opened up my 3rd bottle and I still haven't really noticed much of anything. The taste isn't too bad.

The following comment is for the person who previously reviewed the product: I believe that what you were looking at was NOT the expiration date but rather the date it was made. I bought this product as well and was worried that I would have the same problem as you described until I realized that it had an expiry date as well as a production date. The production date was dated as "something/something 2011." And incidentally, the expiry date on my product was shown to be "something/something 2013" so that also prompts me to think that you probably looked at the wrong date and mistook 2011 for the expiry date.

I have been purchasing this product from GNC and love it--my appetite was curbed and I had more energy, but not the bad jittery type of energy.  The product I received from Amazon was rancid and it looks like the seal was glued back on.  I had a co-worker compare the taste of the product I purchased from GNC and the product I received from Amazon, just to be sure, and she agreed that there was definitely something wrong with the juice I received from Amazon.  If you've never tried this juice, I would suggest you first purchase a bottle from GNC so you know how it's supposed to taste.
I was disappointed with this product. It arrived quickly but does not work for me. Feel it was a waste of money.

Anyone else have seasonal allergy type reactions? This stuff, for me, is hayfever allergies in a bottle.

I performed a little test and here are all the details:

- after taking it Monday twice each day, I thought I suddenly had caught a cold or developed seasonal allergies... I was REALLY bad Tuesday. I had to resort to aspirin and Benadryl to get through the day. It was truly awful and I wanted to go home early for feeling so sick. Headache, itchy eyes, watery mouth, constantly stuffed and runny nose, tired...

- After staying up quite late and finally falling asleep with the window open and the fan on, blowing in whatever pollen or cold air was outside, I woke up today (Wed) feeling totally fine. This is when I knew something was up. No cold or seasonal allergies disappears overnight with the window open and a fan on you.

- So, I did an experiment today. I waited until halfway through the day (2pm) to take the first dose of African Bush Mango juice... the recommended dosage of 2 tbsp. A half hour after drinking this stuff, a mild headache came on, then within the next hour my eyes began itching and my throat felt scratchy and my mouth started feeling watery and, finally, I started sneezing and blowing my nose again.

No doubt about it, this produces a seasonal allergy type reaction for me. Only other time ingesting anything ever did something like this was when I thought I would just go ahead and throw the beet stems in my juicer to be "extra healthy." I am not allergic to beets, but beet stems made my eyes run green snot. This stuff produces almost as bad a reaction. So... throwing away the full $18 bottle when I get home.

I started on this juice about 6 weeks ago with reservation. Did not think it would work, but have noticed a vast difference in fat loss. I take it with every meal consisting of balanced proteins, carbs and fats. Sometimes if I go overboard and overeat I definitely make sure I use it before I engage in a heavy meal.I now have a lot of loose body fat particularly around my waist and upper back area. I look forward to going to the gym to do my cardio and toning excercises to tighten up the loose skin. This juice has definitely made a difference in losing my ab fat. This was my most difficult area to lose. I am a size 10 at the top but wear a size 4 in skirts and pants. Obviously my most stubborn and difficult areas are my abs, back and upper body.I like the taste of this particular brand. I did try another brand but did not like the flavor as much as I like this one. That's the only reason I am able to continue using because the flavor is great. I will continue to use this brand until I reach my goal of fat loss. I've tried alot of products but this seems to be working the best for right now.
IT helped me lose weight but it was expired it was 2010 and i purchased it not to long ago i could have gotten really sick!!!!
I have been taking this for six weeks.  I have not lost any weight.  If I were you I would save my money.
I love the Flake Dipped (I used to live in England).  This is the best price I've found, and they arrived quickly.  I'll reorder soon!

well, they are stated on line as chips then when order they are stixs, and I received expired food product expiration date Dec. 2012....great wonder what they would tasted like fresh.  Will not be ordering from Good Health agin.
I was expecting more nuts but this is mostly gel, in fact some pieces have no nuts at all--also a bit on the too-sweet side for me but if that is what you like then go for it.

If Amazon would get on the ball and offer this cereal with free shipping, I'd order it regularly!  It's the best gluten free hot cereal!  Reminds me of eating cream of wheat and malt-o-meal!  But if I have to pay for shipping, I'm better off buying it at the store.  Come on Amazon!!

I don't have to eat a gluten free diet but I still like this!  It's a great way to consume a variety of whole grains. You can dress it up many different ways and it doesn't get old. We like it with a little peanut butter, agave nectar, and cinnamon! Yum! I'll try it soon with banana also  :  I don't usually pay good attention to the time but I'm pretty sure I usually undercook it some.

I love this stuff.  I would eat it even if I was not gluten free.  It is high in fiber, and low in calories, and tastes really good.  Something that is truly hard to find for those of us that don't consume gluten.

I agree with all the other positive reviews here.  I too discovered this blend from a single pouch offered as part of a selection at a restaurant.  It has the flavor of black tea without the acidity.  The notes of fruit offer just a hint of sweetness, and does not dominant the flavor, which I like (I'm not a fan of fruity herbal teas). After brewing, I mix this dark, rich tea with warm milk to make a tea latte for morning tea.  I don't think I could make this a blend I drink every day but I do enjoy having it around for variety.

This tea is really wonderful but vary expensive in the stores.  It is still expensive buying from Amazon but less so than in the stores.  I will continue to purchase the African Nectar tea from Amazon--a less expensive addiction than wine.  Finding good herbal teas is a hobby of mine.  This one qualifies as one of the best.
Very flavorful herbal tea. Just a hint of sweetness. It is my daily morning beverage. What more can I say?

I am a fan of mighty leaf teas and it is a good deal over here to buy three boxes,
I am happy with the purchase

This tea is awesome. Love it's smoothness... Reminds me of the smoothness of Asaam. It's very light in taste and comforting without hints of bitterness. I love it plain but when the mood strikes, I've added drops of honey, grated ginger or even lemon juice and peels. My bro happened to have it at a fine restaurant several years ago and recommended I try it - been hooked ever since. When friends come over and choose a non-caffeinated tea, they usually choose this one; even the ones who don't usually do teas. So imagine my grin at finding this three-pack on Amazon.

True story: Gave this to a good friend a couple years ago whose mom is a tea connoisseur, highly selective of her loose-leaf brews and doesn't do tea bags. I've heard it sung she rather enjoyed this Mighty Leaf... and ended up taking my friend's whole stash.
This is one of my favorite teas. Had it at a restaurant, bought some online, and I'm NOT dissappointed! You'll love it.

Although I'm not generally a tea drinker, I was introduced to this tea by a friend. Immediately I loved it. It has a fresh and fruity flavor that I find both refreshing and soothing at the same time. I drink it in the evenings because it contains no caffeine and it helps me to unwind after a long day. I highly recommend it for both it's taste and quality.

Enticingly fragrant and delicious, you will undoubtedly enjoy this pick -- the silk bags are biodegradable, and the leaf strength is often enough for me to reuse the bags three times and still enjoy the flavor!

My family has been drinking this tea for a while, but I never really knew what it was all about. When I was offered a cup of this, I instantly fell in love with the rich flavor and aroma. The African Nectar is a great variety as well as the Green Tea Tropical. You will love this no matter how much you know about tea. Great, great product.

I was recently introduced to Green Mountain's Country Blend. A friend sent me several flavored K-cups to try, and one of these was in the package. This coffee is hard to explain exactly. All I can say is they hit it on the head with it's name. It reminds me of a diner I ate breakfast at last time I was up in Vermont. The only way I can impart how this tastes and smells to you is to say that it's like Coffee Peoples Donut Shop coffee (my standard), but made with the mineral-rich water of Vermont, so it's VERY full-bodied. Like brewing it with Dasani bottled water, if that makes any sense to you. It's a VERY pleasing cup of coffee, but maybe not for everyone as it's a touch saltier (but not salty).

If you don't like it, I'm sure you'll find someone on the K-Cup Exchange at Yahoo Groups who will trade it for something you do like, or will buy it from you at a fair price. It's an AWESOME K-Cup web site
H T T P [...]

I brewed this in my B40 @ the 7.25 cup size. I drink my coffee with a liquid creamer and a sugar substitute; just so you will know where I'm coming from.

I received this Kcup in a trade in our Yahoo group who had put together a nice variety pack. I keep a journal of all the Kcups I have tried and I found this to be very pleasant cup of coffee with low acidity little after taste and no bitterness. If I didn't have so many kcups right now I would purchase this wonderful blend.

Got 6 of this variety in a K-Cup Sampler and didn't like it.  I made 2 cups on the strongest setting (6oz.) and it tasted incredibly weak and watered down.  What flavor it did have was kinda strange.  It was sort of woody and mushroomy.  Love my k-cups, just not this one.  So far, the Timothy's Columbian has been my fav.  The Green Mountain Donut house is good as well.

You have to cut this down with Sprite Zero or water (Sprite Zero preferably), because it's SO strong - super limey and acidic.  Better than the Finest Call Carb conscious (which has sugar alcohol in it and makes you feel kinda sick), but not better tasting.

In principle a Splenda Margarita mix sounded like a great idea. The execution was terrible. I poured both of my two bottles down the drain. You would have to be pretty desparate, or otherwise never have had a decent margarita if this was your choice. I would rather skip altogether, as one of the other reviewers had suggested as well. The market has a long way to go to support less sugar in drinks.

I would be the first to applaud these products if they were good.  Unfortunately, I would rather give up drinking that have to drink this tasteless slop.  There is a very nasty, artificial acrid, too citrusy, while at the same time too sweet, taste to these products. The strawberry margherita mix has a very faint taste of strawberry, but no amount of doctoring could make it drinkable.  I poured the mix out.  The Mai Tai mix -- poured it out.  I bought several bottle/dry drink mixes of all their varieties without trying them first.  BIG MISTAKE!  I am either going to pour them out or throw them out, since the folks at Baja Bob's web site have refused to even respond to my request that I return the unopened products for a refund.  You will also note that on their web site's "fan club" page, there are 0 entries.  Save your money unless you are totally desperate.  You'd be better off using Crystal Light Ruby Red Grapefruit.  Now, that tastes pretty good mixed with Vodka.

I'm not sure what the people expect who do not like this product.  I use this as well as the OTB 0 calorie mix you can buy at grocery store and I think they are both great.  I love the margarita but had all the calories.  Give it a try and you will not be sorry!

Traveling world wide, I've come to much prefer good tea to bad coffee, and good teas are so much more common.

Yellow Label is one of the most popular teas in the world because it has a rich, clean flavor without bitterness. Its clear distinctive red color makes it also one of the prettiest. The only supermarket teas I've found in the US that taste similar are the "English Breakfast" labels. If you like these, or like strong black tea flavor without the bitterness or muddiness of overbrewing the usual black teas, you should try Yellow Label.

. . . you'll love this one. I fell in love with this black tea blend when I lived in Europe, and was disappointed when I returned to America that I couldn't buy it here. One taste of this smooth tea and you might change from coffee. It's the best cup of tea you'll ever drink.

This is a repeat of the same review I left for another Amazon listing for the same tea (but at a significantly different price). Despite the price difference, both listings appear to be for the same item and are sold by the same Indian Grocery. From reading the other reviews, it is clear that at least one other customer had the same bad experience as I did.

I was initially excited to find Lipton Yellow Label Tea on Amazon, as I just got back from Italy and fell in love with it there. The Lipton Yellow Label Tea in Italy doesn't taste anything like the weak, poor-quality Lipton we get in the U.S., but the tea I ordered on Amazon (sold by Simply Beautiful) is actually manufactured for India and tastes bitter and/or stale. You can't see from the photo, but the writing on the packages I received is not in English and says it was manufactured in Canada for India. It is hard to tell whether the variety sold in India just tastes different than the kind in Italy, or if the tea was in fact stale, because there is NO sell-by or expiration date on the package (very disturbing), and the bags are NOT "foil-wrapped for freshness" as described on Amazon. I was extremely disappointed in the taste of this tea from India, having looked forward to the lovely, full-bodied Lipton Yellow Label tea bags that I brought home from Italy. Not to mention the fact that I would never want to buy imported groceries that don't have an expiration date, so there is no way to know how long they've been sitting in the warehouse, if they are stale, or when they will go stale after opening (especially since they are not individually wrapped). I returned both boxes of tea and hope to get an Amazon refund soon. I am very bummed.

The Lipton Yellow Label tea is a step above the "regular" Lipton sold here in the States. This is your basic, everyday black tea but it is much more flavorful and bolder than the Lipton variety sold in supermarkets here. It brews a good, bracing cup of tea. I recommend it over the supermarket variety any day. I have used this to make iced tea as well and while it's good over ice, it is best served hot.

I must echo the praise of Lipton Yellow Label tea.

I don't know how this label may differ across countries, but recently I spent several month-long trips to Pakistan, where Lipton Yellow Label is pretty much all the black tea they serve, and tea is served all the time. After getting around the initial shock of their custom of putting up to four teabags into 16 ounces of water there, I came to like the Yellow Label tea. Then when switching a few times to Twinings tea at the hotel business center, I realized that Yellow Label is much better than all the tea I'd been drinking heretofore. Comparing Yellow Label to other Litpons, other tea available in America, and even Twinings, which I considered the top of the heap, Yellow Label was clearly better. A Pakistani friend who travels to the U.S. says that American tea is "insipid" and refuses to drink it. I now agree, and think that Lipton Yellow Tea is the best tea I have ever had. Now I've got to figure out where to buy it. As far as I'm concerned, Yellow Label is the tea most worth drinking, which no doubt accounts for its popularity in Pakistan.

This is a brand of orange pekoe black tea that is drunk all over the world. Lipton sells it in many countries, and while the product might have the same smooth, almost inoffensive base note, to me the UK version tastes very different than the Indian version, which is perceptable stronger and has a more "citrusy" note. While it doesn't hold up to some premium orange pekoe teas, it is distinctly better than the Lipton tea available in US supermarkets.
My wife loves this tea, so I was pleased to be able to order it for her so easily in North America. It arrived promptly, and in good condition.
The company did do a refund for the tea. It looks the same as the box that comes from London. However, it is produced in India and has a very strong, almost bitter taste.
I first had this tea in Egypt.  It is so superior to the Lipton sold in the states that I was grateful to find a source online.

Discovered Yellow Label while on a trip to Japan. I had arrived in Nagoya for a meeting, and had time to wonder around a market...really just rubber-necking.

I bought the familiar Lipton label as well as several other teas. Yellow Label has a little more pronounced flavor than the US marketed Brisk Lipton tea. If you are a tea drinker, you will probably enjoy the flavor. The worst part of brewing and drinking Yellow Label...trying to get rid of the box of US standard Lipton Brisk tea I already have sitting in the pantry.

I've been buying primarily whole leaf, oolong, pu'er, jasmine teas from a wholesale tea market in Beijing (Malian St). Though the price is far cheaper than the Ten  Fu (Ten Ren) teas and other retailers, the discernment in quality seemed questionable. I am a simpleton concerning tea. So rather than purchase $90/kg for the base Assam tea, I went to Carre4 and bought an under $5/box of Lipton Yellow label Black tea 100 bags for the consistant quality.

After running out of my usual every-day tea, Trader Joe's brand of "Irish Breakfast Tea," I found this Yellow Label first at my local Chinese supermarket in the tea aisle. I had only had the "brisk" version before and wasn't such a Lipton fan, but I needed tea and bought it.

Contrary to the rather dusty, mild (watery??) taste of the "brisk" American version, Yellow Label has a good flavor and no bitterness, even when brewing for 6 min (I brew a small pot with three bags in the morning). Not quite as rich as Assam tea when mixed with milk and sugar, but a good substitute. And you can't beat the price. A very nice, full every-day tea.
This is the perfect maple sugar candy...melts in your mouth. The price was also extremely fair. I would buy this again, and recommend it to my friends.

We like the pop-top lid on the canned foods eliminating the can opener wrestling match and test of dexterity. Opening the can of Artemis, one sees a solid dog food, light in color with bits of foods like carrots, peas, and potatoes readily visible.

Our three pooches like Artemis and their parents do also. The ingredient list is commendable with no fillers and none of those horrendous animal scraps found in cheaper dog foods. Mostly I like seeing the inclusion of potatoes in the mix. We like the density of the canned food; those runny canned products with high liquid content tend to dirty and stain the canine whiskers and beard. One user of Artemis commented that her dog had much less gas and fewer stools. I'll have to monitor our girls more closely to see if this is the case with them. I do notice a welcome firmness in Evie's stools though. If you're looking to try a premium pet food, give Artemis a try.

More reasons to try Artemis -

Natural DHA
Superior grade protein (human grade)
Multi protein source
Select vegetables and fruits
Custom vitamin and mineral package
Balanced level of omega 3 & 6
Probiotic/prebiotic
Skin and coat conditioners
Natural - contains no added chemicals, preservatives, artificial additives, or by-products.
No wheat or corn
Guarantee- Artemis guarantees your pet will thrive and be satisfied or 100% money back.
I have used this product for a long time as Lipton has always been a trusted brand.  I do go through A LOT of tea, so buying it on Amazon was quick, and more affordable then other stores.

My husband drinks a lot of green tea, and this is one of our preferred brands.  I also appreciate that the tea is naturally decaffeinated.  He drinks probably up to half a gallon of tea a day, and I appreciate that he doesn't have a large caffeine intake.

I am so happy I switched from coffee to Lipton Decaff Green Tea.
Coffee had been giving me an acid build up which is secreted through my skin, causing burning rashes.
Not that I don't love coffee, but the Lipton Decaff Green, of which I drink sometimes 2 pots a day,
causes no acid build up. So join the happy tea drinkers. GO GREEN!!!!
AMAZON HAS THE LOWEST PRICE ON THIS ITEM......BELIEVE IT!!!!

Getting this product through Amazon has been a pleasure.  The pricing is better than typical retail and it's delivered to my front door free of charge.  I selected to get it sent to me once a month and I can still monitor it and make any changes if necessary.  Again, highly recommended.
I have tried other green teas, but always come back to Lipton as it has the taste I most prefer.
This is a good alternative to caffeine. I like the taste of it.Lipton Green Tea, Decaffeinated, Tea Bags, 40-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)

I work with fondant a lot and I use to buy just white then color it, but that takes a lot of time, is messy, and the colors always turn out different. I discovered Fondarific and I love it!! They have tons of different colors and different flavors. The taste of this is good, the only problem I have is the color is a little darker than I would have liked and when I mix it with white for a lighter purple color it looks more pinkish purple than true purple.
I absolutely love fodarific. This is the third one I've bought and I will continue to buy. It taste really good, and is so easy to work with! Definitely worth the money. Thanks!!
This product made my poor dog sick! I never seen her so sick before. I DO NOT recommend this product at all!
I had no idea that totally "organic" could mean totally "tasteless." The best thing that these can be used for is in cooking oriental dishes or making salads.
Rich garlic flavor.  This is why I ordered it and I am not disappointed!  Generous amount provides enough to last awhile.
This is the best mochi i have had so far! It was very fresh and tasted amazing and it shipped super fast!

I just received my shipment of this mochi yesterday and it tasted weird, not good at all. For clarification, I got the red bean and it comes with six in the package (I couldn't find anywhere how many were inside). I ate the first one, didn't like it, tried another and then threw the rest away. I'll stick to my Kohaku kind, just figured I would try out another brand now I know better.

I was disappointed because it was not like mochi that I have had (and enjoyed) in the past.  The rice cake and bean paste were of about the same consistency, and about equally sweet.  And it didn't have the nice flavor of either the rice cake or the bean paste.

I didn't get these to gross out my family or friends; just curious about the environmental and nutritional advantages Entomophagy. These should eradicate the fear instilled into me by society and pesticide companies :-D

I think I got an expired sampler pack because they tasted rancid and the added flavors are indistinguishable between each of the packs (bland). There isn't an expiration date on any of the boxes so I don't know if dry crickets or the ingredients go bad after a while.

Next on my list, worms :-)

Just what it says and perfect for grossing out your 3rd graders! The flavors, though, leave something to be desired. But really, how flavorful do you really need your halloween prop to be? It was fine and good for the purpose I needed.
Even my 8 year old, who was super excited to eat bugs agrees.  These taste terrible, just disgusting.  Not even worth it for a kid who's happy to be eating bugs.
My son really loves these. He has been watching a lot of those survival tv shows where the need to eat bugs.  While they are way too expensive for what you get, it is quite a novelty gift.
Crystal Light Peach tea give me the type of drink I like and also the amount of water that I have to drink.  I do NOT like to drink water, so the crystal lite is the way to go...

My dog has always loved these, but because they were cheaper and available at the local market - for a while I was buying her generic biscuits. Well, it turns out the poor dog has major food allergies! Now these are all I get for her. She knew best!

I recommend this product because it is a larger size than anything I've seen available through pet stores.

I'm writing this review, however, if my dog could write it, or say it, she would positively rave about this treat! I have a 6-year-old Bichon Frise who loves these dog biscuits - or as she knows them, "cookies"!  She loves the flavor of peanut butter, which is why I bought these originally to try. However, I was pleased to know that the other ingredients in these dog biscuits are oatmeal, eggs, apples and carrots and that everything is made natural. I want my dog to have good snacks (and food!) - and I want her to enjoy what she's eating, too. I have made my third purchase of this product as she loves them - she never hesitates to gobble the "cookie" quickly. She loves them and I know they're good for her - we're both happy! And to top it all off - the price is definitely right! I buy the mini-size as my dog is small. I highly recommend this high-quality dog treat!

My two Italian Greyhound puppies prefer Royal Canin Mini puppy which unfortunately is higher priced.
The quality is probably as good but just not their favorite.

My dog HATES this dog food. She turns her head away from it and refuses to even put it in her mouth. I bought a 1-lb bag at a local pet store(I thought they were treats) and she LOVED it. But they were not small bites. There is something different between the regular and small bites. The only difference mentioned on the labels is duck, but my dog loves duck. So, it must be something else. I don't know what it is, but my dog knows. I bought this 5 lb. bag as treats to sprinkle on her more nutritional mainstay brand or to hand feed because she loved the one from the pet store so much. But I'm not even going to bother with this stuff. I figure there has to be a reason why the dog hates it. So, bottom line, I got bagged.

They were bad enough that I returned them. These are VERY expensive snacks. They should at least taste good. These tasted like they were old and stale. I don't recommend buying these. At lease not in the Island Mango flavor.
What a delicious treat! These are the BEST cashews I have ever had in my life! I will be a repeat customer!

Received as a gift that I had researched/requested. Surprised that it contained 50% broken pieces (mostly tiny), where the photo online shows only whole nuts. Not recommended, unless you don't mind broken pieces.
Loved these cashews. Vacumm packed, whole and full of flavor. Will order again. Shared with others that love cashews and they also agreed.
Hugh.  Delicious.  Perfect for me.  Will buy again. Would make a great gift.  I had all whole cashews, no pieces.

I would have spent the big bucks to order top-rated Blue Buffalo, but was shocked to learn that there was a recent wholesale recall of Blue Buffalo products. Canadae is much more inexpensive and just as nutritious. My dogs love it! They seem much healthier since I've switched to this brand. The folks that sell this are wonderful. Canadae was shipped to me free of charge (Amazon Prime.) It was carefully packaged: no rips, tears, or leaks. I highly recommend.

We could not be happier with this food, we have two labs who had problems with their old food Nutra. Male would have diarrhea at least once a month and the female would have to be watched to make sure she would eat her food. We switched to this after a vet recommended a grain free formula to one of our friends labs who was having problems with his coat. After researching different food brands we decided to not purchase the science diet brand the vet recommend and we went ahead and ordered canidae salmon and potatoes. All the problems stopped as soon as we switched. Our male has no more accidents in the house and the female runs to her food when it is time to eat. They both have more energy and their coats look amazing. Great food and we recommend it to all of our friends and family for their pets. Our dogs health is worth the extra 20 dollars over the pet store brands of dog food.
My dogs have been on this food for three years and are doing very well.

This brand of dog food was recommended to us for our Black Lab, Sadie, as it is very healthy. She absolutely loves it, and her coat is very shiny. We can tell that this is good food, as she is very satisfied. Will definitely order this and possibly other flavors again.
Ingredient wise.... one of the best dog foods in the market. Of course, a bit on the expensive side. Our 3 dogs love this food.

I looked at.several diets for skin sensitive dogs. Am already feeding a salmon diet and salmon oil bit wanted to mix. The canidae has a good name, top ingredients and at time great price
Went to order another bag 1 mo later and price had changed by $6-$7 per bag. Am now looking again.

My three dogs like it a lot, and my problem dogs skin has improved dramatically.
His hair his growing back and his skin is not red and itchy anymore. I'vebtried the "Blue" dogfood and it didn't work at all.

Our 6-year old Vizsla has been eating Canidae for 3 years. A month ago we switched flavors from Bison to Sea Salmon.  We gradually transitioned the change even though it was the same company.  Within four weeks on the new flavor he developed a set of distressing systems including soft, mucus covered stools, horrible gas,low energy, staggering walk, excessive drooling, licking and constant neck extending (difficulty swallowing).  A vet visit confirmed these as diet related.  We put him on a chicken/rice diet and his symptoms stopped after just two days.  Doing research to decide whether to switch back to bison or go with another company, I found a great deal of  information about other pet owners having issues with all flavors of food from Canidae. Consumer Affairs reports a pending class action suit.  We have decided to switch to another company.
Since using this product my dogs coat has improved soooooo much.  He loves it.  He does have fish breath, but his health is has improved.
This product is made from the best ingredients.  My dog was allergic to chicken-based dog foods so my vet suggested salmon.  This is a quality salmon dog food without a strong fishy odor.

Our Rhodesian Ridgebacks were on this food some years back and we moved, thus losing access to it at the new location. I am very glad to see Amazon carrying Canidae and that it's available using the Prime Membership! We have fed many, many dogs the Canidae when we we were fostering rescue dogs (an average of 3 new dogs a month for years) and it was the only food NONE of them ever had any trouble eating & digesting. Our own pack has a couple of members with soy allergies, so I'm careful about what we feed. They have been back on the Canidae for a few months now with no drama at all. The switch from their old food back to the Canidae was easy and stress free and all 6 dogs scarf it down like it was prime rib. (or you know...a squirrel) Even my father's Chihuahua likes it and that little diva used to think she could only eat human food! I have been able to cut back by a half cup on the daily ration for our largest dog as he was putting extra weight on with his previous amount from the old food. Everyone's coat is soft and shiny, they all have loads of energy and are generally in excellent overall health - that doesn't happen with the grocery store bargain foods. Again, I am VERY VERY glad to see the big bags of Canidae available from Amazon!!

Our dog loves this brand. We used their Chicken & Rice formula for about a year & decided to switch to the Lamb & rice one after our dogs interest-level started going down. How did we find out? We realized that over time we have been mixing more treats in her food to get her to eat it (This with only 2 meals a day!)

Our dog definitely preferred lamb over the chicken, no more treat mix-in's, only pure dog-food!

We = Canidae fans for life!

I should've done more research before buying this product. My dog seemed to have very little appetite when she was on this food. She had skin problems. She had loose stools. Unfortunately I didn't want to believe that it had anything to do with the food. I finally decided to look into it after months of trying to get her to eat it more regularly and found that my problems weren't uncommon with this food. I've since switched her to Blue Buffalo food and her skin problems have gotten better, she has become more energetic, her stools are no longer loose and she happily eats.

My dog got horrible diarrhea from it.
We mixed it with her old food for about a week and after that gave her just the Canidea food.
Too bad, it seemed like a good brand though.

Canidae has changed the formula of their ALS recipes.  Many, many dogs have become ill after eating the new formula.  The web is full of complaints from dog owners whose dogs are experiencing the same awful symptoms (Diarrhea, vomiting, itching, hot spots and even seizures).  Do your homework before buying this product.  The company changed the formula without notifying the public.  Would give zero stars if possible.

I've heard this is a good food, but was shocked to see after chicken meal so many grains. I did not feed this to my dog. I'd rather pay more money for better quality food. All those fillers are unneeded. I expect such a highly regarded company to have better ingredients. I always look for by products but didn't think to even bother to check the next 4 ingredients. Highly disappointed.

This has given my young dog persistent loose stools. My older dog also had problems with loose stools on the adult formula, which was immediately rectified by a change to Innova. See the large number of serious complaints on the web about the new formulation before buying.

I have a two and a half year old female Boxer that has allergies to most commercial dog foods, so I keep her on a diet free of wheat, soy, and animal by-products.  Canidae seemed to fit the criteria and was available at my local pet store (whereas, the brand I was feeding, Evo, had to be ordered), so I wanted to try it.  I've been feeding my dog three and a half cups of Canidae dry dog food daily (divided between two feedings) for about five weeks, and she has lost a significant amount of weight on this diet.  She is a very active dog that has always been lean, but she is now too skinny. I will be switching back to Evo and would not recommend Canidae.

I purchased Canidae Dry Dog Food, Chicken Meal and Rice Formula for my two Cocker Spaniels (Cavalier King Charles and American breed). After about two weeks, the problems began. Diarrhea, some vomiting and general malaise. Further feeding resulted in more problems. We had fed them Blue Buffalo and Eukanuba in the past but had never experienced these kind of problems. We returned to Eukahuba and both pets have returned to normal. I'm unsure what ingredients caused the problem but I will never use this product again and recommend caution before feeding your dog this food!Canidae Dry Dog Food, Chicken Meal and Rice Formula, 30-Pound Bag

Loved the taste, the smell, everything. Better than what I used to make myself years ago.

And the BEST delivery from a second party shipper that I have ever received. Many thanks !

Buy this applesauce, you will NOT be disappointed.
For colombian ground coffee lovers , this is a brand you will really love and you wont be sorry at all for purchasing it

Community coffee is the best brand of coffee made.  Being from Louisiana and driving passed the Community coffee processing plant and smelling the coffee being roasted is an experience one never forgets.  I have drank this brand all of my adult life and there is none to compare with it.  I have drank all of the varieties of this brand and dark roast was my favorite until----i tried the Columbia Classico Blend and now at 62 i have a new favorite.  It has a sweeter taste than the other varieties, not quiet as strong as the dark roast, but strong enough to be "real" coffee.  I love it and so glad i tried it. Thanks Amazon for carring it and especially having it on a subscribe and save plan.

I bought since it seemed like a great deal but when i made a batch it was awful. It had a weak taste and the aroma was as if it was old coffee. Completely disappointing i love trying all coffees and expected more from this. Will never buy again. I thought i would never have to say this but Dunkin Doughnuts is way superior so try that first. Seattle Best is a great coffee as well.

Good price for Community Coffee pack of 3.  Received quickly.  Product packages were sealed but not firm bricks like I expected. I will say that the flavor was not compromised by that.  Will probably order these again.

Weak, dry, tasteless coffee. Doesn't taste even remotely like it was made with Columbian Arabica beans. The grind was also of very poor quality.

How bad was it? This stuff makes Folger's seem like premium, high grade stuff. I have no earthly idea how people give this Community Colombian Classico such a high rating. Perhaps I just got a bad batch of very old stuff from Amazon but I'll not be giving this coffee a second chance! Probably one of the weakest and most tasteless coffee beans I've ever bought.

I don't know if the name "Community Coffee" is intended to convey a coffee for the masses, but that's kinda how I would rate it. It smells good when you open the package, you use a normal amount to brew, it has a good flavor & aroma. No disappointments, but nothing special. I have a hard time distinguishing this from other typical brands of columbian coffee . . . no worse, no better.

In my case, a half of the cans were smashed. I'm not saying that the can was destroyed. Also, it was within the expiration date. However, foods in some of the cans were discolored...must be getting old.

So technically speaking, there are nothing 'wrong' with them... But made me keep wondering if they are safe. So for a peace of mind, I decided not to order this product again.
2 of the six cans were smashed when received - maybe they should pack them better for shipment or not send smashed cans

I recently purchased this item and tried my first cup last evening. A bit of an aftertaste sent me searching for the ingredients list, which is not on the individual cup but is on the original packaging. Sucralose is hiding in the ingredients, which, while not a big deal, is not a taste I enjoy. Prospective buyers should be aware of the presence of an artificial sweetener, which is not advertised or noted in any way in the product description on Amazon. (The manufacturer website notes that both natural and artificial sweeteners are used.) It's certainly something I'll be checking before making future purchases of this type of item. Overall flavor (except for the sweetener issue) is acceptable but don't look for rich, creamy body with this beverage.

The Taste of this Chocolate almost made me pack up my Keurig and take it Back to the store! I purchased this Hot Cocoa out of excitement when I brought my Mr. Coffee Keurig on sale for Black Friday.  I am an avid hot cocoa drinker and this by far is the worst tasting chocolate in my opinion. It was watery and had an awful artificial sweetener aftertaste. Granted the first time I did not shake the K-cup as directed so I gave it a second try after shaking. Surprisingly it didn't do a d@mn thing to help the taste! On the bright side if you long for a watered down artificial sweetener as an after taste in a drink then this is the K-cup for you.

Recently tried this milk chocolate k cup from Amazon. The only thing this drink has in common with chocolate is its color.Of the 13 items listed as ingredients  cocoa is number 8.It has a chemical smell and a chemical taste.If you buy this junk don't say you were not warned. It does not deserve ANY stars.

This is excellent hot chocolate, and I will buy this again
and recommend it highly. Very good flavor, very smooth
and actually tastes like chocolate.

Our family loves to have hot chocolate on a cold winter's day and this is not hot chocolate.  I don't know what it is.  You need to find another product for your Keurig if you are looking for hot chocolate.  Please do not waste your money on this product.  There is no quality control on this one.  How Keurig thinks this is good is beyond me.
Absolutely horrible, I have never had such terrible hot cocoa, very artificial taste .  It's going back!,  Waste of $13!

The aftertaste from the artificial sweetener is terrible! Waste of money, as the box makes no mention that it's full of nastiness. Yuck yuck yuck. I can still taste the chemical aftertaste and it's been at least 30 minutes! It tastes like I've sucked on a penny!
You've been warned. I honestly don't understand the 4 & 5 star reviews... It's such a bitter, strong aftertaste!

Cafe Escapes Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa for the Keurig is for the birds. I am truly sorry about this guys but it was nothing more than chocolate flavored water. This probably is not your fault since it is made with water. However, I can tell you that the very first company that can produce a hot chocolate made with water that actually tastes like a full bodied hot chocolate will be millionaires. Put a little body to the chocolate and you will have a true winner!
This was pleasant to drink and easy to prepare. I would have preferred a more chocolaty flavor.  Perhaps a thicker consistency would be an improvement.
As others have said, it has the chemical taste of artificial sweetener. When will these companies realize that there are a ton of consumers out there who do NOT like sugar substitutes!

This was the first k-cup I tried out with my Keurig coffee maker, and while good it had a weird metallic aftertaste. At first I thought it was because the coffee maker was new, but i'm still getting that weird taste after many other brews later. If you don't have sensitive taste buds it's great, but if you do.. stick with the Green Mountain Hot Chocolate.
Wonderful hot cocoa! Great flavor, its very important to shake the cup before brewing and to use the right cup setting. Will definitely buy again!

I found the taste way too sweet for me. I tried it with less water, more water, added creamer, still could not shake the taste. Very disappointing. Only used it at the office anyway so I am sticking with Swiss Miss packages for my hot chocolate fix.
Incredibly disappointed with this product. Tastes nothing like hot cocoa, just watered down. The sucralose gives it a chemical aftertaste.

I normally drink coffee in my keurig but I tried these for something different. They tasted almost like the weak hot chocolate you get out at an amusement park from a machine or something. I would not recommend them. I have a machine that lets you pick what size cup you want, small or medium and even on the small the hot chocolate is watery.
I was really excited to try hot cocoa in the Keurig - but these are just awful.  We tried adding creamer but that didn't really help either.  Definitely won't be purchasing again!

I am a hot chocolate freak. I was very anxious to try the varieties of hot chocolate with my new Keurig. This cocoa was my first purchase. It was so terrible I almost brought it back. First, it took half the box to get the plastic taste out of the drink. A Keurig issue. That last half of the box didn't redeem itself. This cocoa tastes like flavored water, flavored with diet sugar. It has the same aftertaste you would get with a diet soda or a sugar-free yogurt. Also, you can't get more than 8 oz per cup. If you do, the taste just gets more watered down. A huge disappointment. I will be trying other brands but my expectations are very low based on this first experience.

I read a few reviews and learned that this product contains sucralose. It is not listed as an ingredient. Explains the diet taste plus I don't trust manufacturers who pull stunts like this. The manufacturer is Green Mountain Coffee - very disappointing.

This is probably one of the worst hot chocolate brands I have ever purchased.  It is one of those things that has a "something is wrong but I'm not exactly sure what" kind of taste.  In some ways the flavor is like chocolate water.  In others it is more like carob. It just tastes fake.  I will not ever purchase this brand again.

I agree with the other one-star reviews. It has a strange flavor unlike chocolate and more like chemicals. It's watery. I will try a different brand of hot chocolate or just use my personal K cup to put in my own hot chocolate mixes.

I'm not an avid coffee drinker, so when I bought my Keurig I really had my eye on the other drink types (teas, cocoas, hot cider.)  These was the first hot chocolate k cup, and I'm sorry to say that I don't like them at all.  The drink is watery, and has a strange after taste.  I hope one of the other hot chocolate k cups are better than this.

Don't waste your money! Garage sales this summer will be full of this crap. This is the worst hot cocoa I have ever tasted in my life. Tried it a second time ,thought I didn't make it right. Couldn't sleep all night & today I'm sick to my stomach. It is full of chemicals, not real food. Why would anyone want to waste there hard earned money on something that could possibly do you in!
Tastes like chocolate water with artificial sweetener.  Really not worth drinking.  The changes in formula necessary to make cocoa mix fit into the little cup really ruin it.

Thankfully this came in a variety pack, so I only had one.  But god, was it nasty.  I'd already been told by a family member not to go with the "large" setting on my Keurig, as it could make cocoa taste watery.  So I dutifully chose "medium," and oh, how I wish watery were the problem.  It had such a horrible bitter taste that I at first thought my water had somehow been contaminated.  After reading other reviews here, I realize that it must be the sucralose.  I consider it not only very misleading advertisting for each cup not to be labeled as "diet" in some way, but sucralose also happens to be my least favorite of the major artificial sweeteners.  I don't know what the calorie count on these things would be, but if it happens to be low then I'd recommend trying this only if you're dieting and really desperate.  For people wanting a normal hot cocoa taste, avoid at all costs.

This product is very bland. I got it because my kids love hot chocolate, and usually they use my keurig just for hot water to mix their own hot chocolate. They were so excited to get this, but they didn't even drink their first cup of it because it has almost no chocolate flavor. I had to mix chocolate syrup in with it to give it any kind of flavor at all.

I got a bunch of these from a friend and wondered about the bad after taste. It wasn't like products completely flavored with Splenda (sucrolose) but it still a slight strange taste (I describe it as slimy) and left that after taste in my mouth. On the k-cup it self, it doesn't say it has artificial sweeteners or is diet, so I came to the internet and it is almost impossible to find the ingredients listed any where. The reviews were the confirmation at first. Too much Splenda makes me sick to my stomach so I know it is not good for me. Too much is more than a few tastes. Oh well, I guess I'll try the Grove Square or Swiss Mix as those are the only others I can find.

I find the taste of this product unappealing and the after taste sickening.

I made 6 oz cup of this and it tasted awful.  It lacked milk chocolate flavor and was very watered down.  I was very disappointed because hot cocoa was the main beverage I wanted to brew since I do not drink coffee.  This was very bad.

I tried the Cafe Escapes Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa Keurig K-Cups and the Cafe Escapes Chai Latte. I like sweet things, but both of these are seriously way too sweet. The Chai Latte has a much more pronounced artificial sweetener flavor and aftertaste, but this too has the same artificial sweetener flavor. Not good at all.

We bought this KCUP because we wanted some hot cocoa around. It is completely watered down and lacks a lot of the chocolate flavor each time. If you like rich hot cocoa, this is not the hot cocoa for you.

I bought these for the kids and they love them.  Since it comes out too hot for them we put two ice cubes in the coffee cup and brew the hot chocolate on the 4oz size cup right over the ice.  It comes out at the perfect temperature for kids.

With winter approaching I bought this as a trial. I was concerned that it would taste watered down because I feel that many of the Keuring coffees taste that way; I like the extra bold varieties or Starbucks Italian Roast on my own K cup.

I was actually rather pleasantly surprised as to how much like real hot cocoa it tasted. Not watered down and not too sweet. It's not gourmet but this winter, when you want a quick cup of hot cocoa after shoveling snow or playing outside, this will do nicely.
This tastes terrible. Even the powdered hot cocoa mixes where you can pour hot water taste a lot better (and cheaper)!

Honestly, was not was what I was expecting when I ordered - it was bitter and tasted like splenda! Delivery was great, received order on time etc - but the product itself was disgusting - I couldn't even give it away at work! I left it in the break room at work and it went untouched!

This is one of the best products for the K-cups system. The hot chocolate is just right, not too sweet, very rich and creamy and full bodied. I like that it does not have a sodium flavor like many instant hot chocolates do. Add a few drops of milk or 1/2 & 1/2 and it is awesome.

Back when I made my first cup (last year), it was indeed watery.  I thought how it would be nice if so much chocolate wasn't left in the k-cup after brewing (yes, I removed the foil, to recycle the cup).  I decided to shake the cup before inserting into the Keurig, and I'll remove it and re-insert after twisting it 180°, giving it another hole to brew from, which DOES help.  I prefer the taste of this to Swiss Miss or Nestle for sure.  I also add Vanilla or Irish Creme powdered CoffeeMate creamer which thickens it up a bit, or will add some Bailey's or Amaretto after shovelling show.  I like the Dark Chocolate version as well.
This tasted, watery and I used the smallest amount of water you can use with a k cup - 6 oz. The chocolate was flavorless but mostly it was just super weak.  I do not recommend.
These plants looked dead and were very small.  I watered them as directed and they still look the same.  I've had them for a few weeks and follow the directions every time I water them.

I love these candies.... However, the entire case was ruined, not one piece was not damaged, obviously they had melted either prior or during shipping. The chocolate was stuck to the top of the paper they are wrapped in. . They were still edible, but didn't quite taste the same, the chocolate was gooey instead of solid, even days later when stored at room temperature. They really disappointed me :( So I am hoping the next case I purchase will be fresh, as I am ordering in October a cooler month, and hoping it was ruined in delivery and not the sellers storage.

WAS GREAT HOW FAST THE PRODUCT GOT HERE.  I HAVE NEVER HAD A PRODUCT GET HERE THAT FAST.  WAS PLEASED TO HAVE THE CANDY HERE ONLY PROBLEM WAS IT HAD MELTED BUT WE ARE STILL EATING IT.  THANKS AGAIN FOR BRINGING BACK A MEMORY FROM WHEN I WAS OVERSEAS IN THE ARMY.

I purchased this tea at a retail store. I was terribly, terribly disappointed. It didn't taste bad...it tasted like nothing at all. I wasn't expecting a strong taste but the tea bags don't even smell like anything. Literally...nothing. They are the nice fabric-bag type tea bags. This was my first experience with this brand...maybe their other flavors are better.
This product arrived in about three days.  Never use the entire packet for one recipe unless you like hot seasonings!  It is extremely hot.
This bread works perfect with soup or by itself. Really a wonderful, full flavored bread. I put the mix in my bread maker on the basic setting and then out came another hit from The Prepared Pantry!

Thought that I was getting a gr8 deal when i ordered the 2000 pack for $44 from amazon...the order arrived in time and in good condition but while visiting a nearby costco in the following week of receiving the order, saw that the 1000 pack box was on regular price for $19 each....plus they have $3 - $5 coupons from time to time which could have brought it down to $16 - $17 per 1000 pack.

We've used Splenda and Kirkland brand sucralose packets. either product is very good for what it is, a no-calorie sweetener for hot or cold drinks, desserts, and breakfast cereal.
For convenience, rather than the best price, I purchased this 2000-packet box of real Splenda-brand from Amazon. After using the product for a few days, i noticed my wife replaced her normal morning ice coffee with diet soda. She couldn't stand the Splenda, it was giving her a dry mouth and bad taste. i had noticed something a little "off" but just dismissed it as my imagination. Later i tried a sample straight from the envelope, it had a very acrid taste and seemed to burn -- it certainly wasn't SWEET. i then did a blind taste test using a new, small box that i bought from a local grocery store. night and day difference. in summary, i think i got either an old/expired box (there's no obvious expiration date on the box), or the product might have soaked up an odor/taste from something during transit.

As I reported to Amazon previously the packaging was terrible. alot of loose sugar inside the box. When I opened the shipping carton My wife and I noticed the original Splenda box was not properly sealed. The Splenda box was literally unsealed and open. It made us leary to think that someone might have tampered with the shipment. As of today no harm has come. The sugar is the same. The quantity is wonderful. The price well I've seen it for less.
On this particular deal one gets the best artificial sweetener at the best price in a large quantity with exceedingly fast shipping, no reason to try another.

I do not live in the United States, and I am used of Splenda, and where I live nowadays, splenda is very expensive and not easy to find, and I found out that if I order it online from Amazon.com, I will get it much cheaper than where I live.
No fancy box just great price. I had always purchased large amount of Splenda at wholesale club now I can buy it from Amazon at even better price with free shipping and no member fee.

being a type 11 diabetic i have to avoid sugar,
splenda was the reccommended choice at the hospital
and i am now completely sold on this product.
a REALLY great amazon value helps alot also
Splenda is Splenda.  The quantity for the price was the sole reason for buying this product.  With Splenda packets, I go for the pricing.  I only use Splenda in my coffee.

when i turned 30 i cut sugar out of my diet purely as a health maintenance measure. now in my 40's my blood pressure, BMI, cholesterol and blood sugar continue to be healthy for my age and height, despite being inactive. so something has got to change if you want to stay healthy - lifestyle or diet, but preferable both if you can manage it. i use about 20 Splenda packets per day in my beverages. I have tried all other sweeteners for at least a week each, and while I'd like to support Stevia use - I just could not handle it's leafy taste even in my ice tea, which is already leafy.
i was concerned that may be too much since many web sights warn of aluminum buildup in your liver - so i contacted Cargill and tried to find out what amounts of Splenda did their human trails involve - but they would not tell me - only said there is no consumption limit. that's why I took a star off my review - i wish Splenda's maker would be more forthcoming when a consumer contacts them with a legitimate concern. if you can tolerate sugar, when making a gallon of beverage, add one tablespoon of sugar per 16 grams of Splenda, to soften the metallic taste of this sweetener.

This was the best deal on Splenda that I've found. It was shipped fast and I have been dipping into it ever since it arrived. I have given up on sugar and this fit's the bill better then the other substitutes.
Seller had item shipped rather quickly. It was as advertised.
We use a lot of Splenda and this is a great buy.  The product came quickly and in good condition.
Es la segunda vez que compro con este proveedor y el margen de error en las bolsas empacadas es del 2.5% aunque en este último pedido llegó en un mejor estado.
I USE SPLENDA PACKETS EVERY SINGLE DAY. LOVE THIS PRODUCT AS IT IS CALORIE FREE AND EASY TO USE. ALSO DIABETIC FRIENDLY. I WATCH FOR IT TO GO ON SALE A LOT AS WE USE A LOT
I could not find this product on any store shelf.  Amazon came through.  Makes the best WS's.
The cost of the mix to the number of drinks you get is much to high.
I am happy that i bought the set rather than Individual items. Great deal guys. Cant wait for the great specials!!!

This is a nice jelly that spreads fairly easily and the bottle makes it easy to apply to your sandwich or whatever else you want jelly for. It has a really nice grape-y flavor, so if you really like grape jelly, give this a try.

I was disappointed in this product especially considering how exceptional the Salmon Oil they make is.

This did not pass the 11 rescue dog test! They just turned up their noses. So did the other dogs here. Very tiny tidbits, as well.Buy an extra bottle of the Grizzly Salmon oil instead.

We originally tried these treats when we received as a sample. My dog loved them, and i thought the smell was so fishy, no wonder he did!
The bag will last a long time. Do not feed too many, as it states on the package. It is a good value. Could even be cut in half or smaller to use as training rewards.

My dog can't get enough of these things. He gets so excited anytime he even hears the bag crinkle. We were told at obedience class to bring treats our dogs will do anything for and this was my choice. I'm back ordering more. With two labs, I wish I could order in bulk.

These are excellent treats, my dog really likes them, but from this seller specifically, they arrived almost completely pulverized so it was mostly a bag of salmon dust.  I used them to supplement the dog food, but they were mostly useless as treats.

I've been giving these to my 2 little dogs for over 5 yrs. They love them and I love giving them to my girls.
They are a nutritious salmon protein treat with essential amino acids and calcium. They're low calorie
with no artificial anything.
And... they're made from Alaskan Wild Salmon in the Pacific Northwest -- not salmon from the polluted
waters of the east coast. We use them for training treats, just because treats and in their puzzle toys.
They never lose their interest when rewarded with these treats. I highly recommend.
My dog LOVES these treats! The ingredients are so good for her and they don't cause any allergies or reactions either. Great product!

It's funny that most of the other reviews talk about using it straight, when I've never used it that way or even thought to try using it as shoyu! I use it as a soup base for zaru soba, somen salad, and udon. We mostly use it for hot udon. You basically put different amounts of water for whatever noodle you're eating and it tastes amazing each time. For instance, udon uses 1 part memmi, 12 parts water. It's extremely simple and tastes soooo good. Me and my daughter always drink the soup after and I make extra now so that we can have a lot of soup to drink with each noodle! This is really an amazingly good sauce! I'm hoping they eventually add subscribe and save for it.

Although it says "Soup Base" on the bottle, my family hardly uses it for that purpose. It works great for everyday cooking and I would describe it as a sweet soy sauce. Try it on any type of meat and cooked vegetables. You can get a 20oz bottle for ~3-4$ at an Asian market.

This is a wonderful addition to soup stocks or packaged ramen in place of the "flavor packet". I use it often and enjoy the unique flavor it adds to chicken stock or water. Well worth experimenting with.

My lab mix has a very sensitive tummy. He had recurrent bouts of diarrhea, vomiting and constant wretched gas. I had given him pedigree for awhile but realized that was no good for him. Then we tried science diet, but his gas seemed to get worse and his tummy would gurgle all day.

I read about this dog food and its natural ingredients. There's no corn meal or other fillers. He's been on this food for about 2 weeks now and his gas has disappeared! He has not had a single bout of diarrhea or vomiting. I'm impressed. Yes it's pricey and I normally wouldn't buy something so expensive, but it is well worth it for the health of my dog.

*Updated* to say that he has been on this food for a few months now and has continued to be free of tummy troubles and wretched gas. He hasn't vomited at all or had diarrhea. His coat has gotten so much shinier and he seems to be a much happier dog without all the tummy issues!

I love this food. It actually is the only food I have found that my dog is not allergic to. (except for an extremely expensive prescription diet) I have a boxer on this food. He is allergic to almost everything. However, he is not allergic to salmon or sweet potatoes making this food the perfect choice for him. All food related allergies have disappeared and his coat has improved tremendously. He still deals with outdoor allergies, but this food has shown a big improvement in him. The only issue I have had is that he packed on a few extra pounds, which he has now lost. I cut down his dry food amount and mix canned green beans and carrots in with the dry food so he has enough to eat without the extra weight. He loves it and eats every bite!
The only brand that wont give my doggies the itch and allergies! Been loyal to the brand for 4 years now...

Be cautious about all store dog foods. My dog had been eating Natural Balance Sweet Potato and Fish and developed digestive issues and almost died. I thought it was a number of things. Had lots of tests run and then one of my clients dogs developed the same issues with his dog on the same dog food and has also spent a lot of money trying to correct the gut issue. Can't prove anything as we got rid of the dog food, but since they recalled their Sweet Potato and Chicken this year because of (see below)...Posted: Jun 21, 2010 at 4:00 PM [Jun 21, 2010]

In 2007, a pet food recall was issued after the FDA discovered that vegetable proteins imported from China that were used to produce pet foods were contaminated with melamine. Sadly, some animals were sickened, and even died. After this recall, it's fair to say that many of us had become even more aware of how the pet food industry is regulated and how lapses are corrected, which is a great thing. Knowledge is power, as the saying goes.

The FDA posted a new announcement for a voluntary pet food recall on June 18 - relating to Natural Balance Pet Foods, Inc. More specifically, the company discovered that there was the possibility of salmonella contamination in 5- and 28-pound bags of their Sweet Potato and Chicken Dry Dog Food. Consumers who have purchased that formula need to look for a "best by" date of June 17, 2011.

Flickr photo courtesy of Denise Chan
Salmonella, also referred to as salmonellosis, causes digestive problems, and dogs will typically present with fever, diarrhea, vomiting, and weakness. Other symptoms can occur.
Salmonella is a zoonotic disease, meaning that it can be passed to humans as well, so care needs to be taken. Hand washing is a must - even when handling dry pet food that may be contaminated with the bacteria.

To keep up to date with current recalls and information on pet food safety, visit the FDA's website to view the updated list that includes not only dog and cat foods, but also horse feed.

[...]

I have a Jack Russell Terrier. It has an allergic reaction to chicken and some grains.  This food seems to have solved most if not all of its allergy problems.  The dog had chewed itself raw.  After a couple of weeks of this dog food, hair was growing back with only occasional scratching.  Nothing like it use to be.  I gave it 5 stars because it worked.  Would my dog rather have burger or steak... yes.  But, it does eat this.  I order a bag a week and a half before I run out.  Not as cheap as regular dog food, but saves on the Vet bills.  Fifty dollars a bag for the dog food, versus a minimum, $150 for a visit to the Vet.

My dog has an over abundance of ear wax and the vet suggested I try this food. My dog has been eating this exclusively for 10 days and it has made him sick. He has tons of gas and diarrhea. The only thing positive that I can say is that he liked the taste.

I was very happy with this product at first, as it solved my little dog's skin problems. Now, almost 2 years later, my dog has developed really bad cough allergy. I have solidly confirmed the food is the root cause by stopping & trying it again. I just want to mention that this is a 2nd time we have to discontinue dog food after years of use, due to newly developed allergies.

I have been a faithful buyer of Natural Balance for years for my large dog with allergies. Thinking I was getting the best.

My dog developed a yeast infection that my vet told me was allergies. He has constant ear infections, itching and he started to lose weight. His skin was like an elephant and it started to flake off. Turns out the potatoes and sweet potatoes in the Potato and Venison dog foods was feeding the yeast infection and it was killing him. He was losing weight and went from 75 pounds to 57 pounds before we found out the cause. I contacted the food company who were no help at all. They didn't even respond to my reply. I wasn't asking for any miracles, I just wanted some answers and I got a big fat NOTHING.

After switching vets my new vet discovered the yeast infection and we switched the dog food. He started to gain weight but we have a long road ahead of us to keep the yeast at bay.

I am just disappointed in the company's customer service. I spent about $50 on a bag of food every two weeks plus treats. My money will be better spent elsewhere.

My ten month old doxie/mix started having horrible stomach problems.  She would regurgitate her food within minutes after eating it.  After spending $1000 at the vet and having no reason for why she was getting sick, I decided to look into a different kind of food.  She was on Wellness before and the vet switched her to a special canned food.  Then he had me switch her to Science Diet Sensitive Stomach.  She did fine on the canned food, but got sick with the Science Diet.  Once I started this food, she stopped getting sick.  It was a miracle!  Her gas has gone away and she has kept the food down for over two months.  I'm so happy with this food!  I switched her brother onto the food too, and they both love it.

Natural Balance dog food is great, but the dog food I purchased from Amazon was not completely satisfactory.  There was about a 4 pound clump of dog food that was so hard and compressed, it would have been unreasonable to break apart or use.  a 5 pound bag of this dog food goes for $13, so  I feel like I lost money on this purchase for the convenience of having it delivered instead of an in-store pickup.  I won't be purchasing dog food from Amazon again.  I don't feel as if they rotate the food out as well as it would if one were to purchase it from Petco or PetSmart.

I ordered the natural balance salmon dry dog food because I had good luck with the natural balance salmon dry cat food.  Further, I am a pescatarian and was disappointed to see how almost every dry dog and cat food brand at the grocery stores and on the market contain chicken, lamb, or beef bi -products.  I love my dogs, but I cannot see feeding baby lamb to my dog! Even the "only fish" labelled dog and cat foods on the market often contain chicken, etc when you look on the ingredients list.  So I was very pleased to find a cost effective solution to this in natural balance.  The only issue is that my dogs will not touch this food! They would rather starve than eat it it seems, perhaps because it is the diet formula?  I'm not sure.  However, I will say that they all (including the cat) flock to the Natural Balance salmon dry cat food lol so I will continue ordering that for the cat.

I bought this food having bought several of their other flavors previously. However, this particular flavor does not agree with my dog's system. That being said I can't say enough good things about the Natural Balance company.

My pure bread yellow lab is surprisingly a very picky eater and after going through several other brands this is the only food he will eat.  He doesn't have allergies that we're aware of and hasn't had any bad reactions to other foods, he just won't eat them.  Now I've moved to an area where I can't get this food at a nearby store, so I've come to Amazon.com to start ordering it regularly for delivery.

This product made my dog very sick. He is an older 11 year old pug with allergies and this particular mix is supposed to be good with allergies. I decided to try it because my vet had run out of Science Diet Salmon and Sweet Potato and I found this very reputable looking dog food with free shipping on Amazon Prime.

Within 3 days off feeding it to my dog he seemed to loose all energy and my wife was concerned we wouldn't have him very much longer. I then Googled the brand and found a recall due to salmonella contamination! Granted, the recall wasn't on this specific mix, but when I tried to contact the company they haven't even bothered to respond within four days! I ran out and found another vet who carries science diet and within a day or two my dogs is energetic and back to his old self. This dog food is supposed to be 100% guaranteed, just return the unused portion back to the retailer - yeah, shipping 28 lbs of dog food back to Amazon and finding the box it will fit in is real convenient...

I have a 7 year old female Newfoundland who has had allergy problems for years.  I have tried all sorts of things except buying hypoallergenic dog food.  After reading review about this food, I thought I would give it a try.  She is getting around much better, has more energy, quit licking hair off feet, ears getting better, and her coat is getting more beautiful color back(bronze).  Financially it is not easy to buy this food! I have 6 dogs total, a few I found and took in, not that we can afford to.  In this difficult economy people are just dropping their dogs off and the shelters are full.  I would love to have all my dogs on a good food like Natural Balance but can not afford it.  So, my Newfoundland will be the only one on it because of her problems.

My dog was eating this food and has had bad gas, bloody and loose stools.  We have stopped giving this to him but we are still trying to get his tummy troubles under control.  All blood tests, stool tests, and urine tests have come back OK.
I don't know what happened to my favorite coffee, santa white christmas coffee, but barnies really turned this coffee into tasteless coffee I will never buy again... what a shame
this is a lightweight gaiter that is easy-on and easy off.the only improvement that i can imagine would be the zipper,which is a little hard to engage.
