The price of the pods was very inviting compared to the Timothy's brand. I purchased the French Roast Decaf for my wife and the regular French Roast for myself. We both drink our coffee black and found it favorful and not at all bitter. I highly recommend San Francisco Bay French Roast.

5 Stars on flavor. I was concerned about the design of this 'Kcup' but its sturdy. The only thing that would make this coffee better would be if the packaging was resealable. Its annoying that I have to put them in their own zip lock once the plastic bag is cut.
The coffee is excellent! Having it delivered makes it convienent and the 80 count lasts long enough for two of us for  a month. Willl definitely keep this coming!

When reading the other reviews, I was hesitant to get it, but I am glad I did!  The smell from opening one of the mini bags in the box was amazing, definitely proving it to be a "French Roast."  The taste isn't as strong as other French Roast coffees, but that's fine with me.  This brews up perfectly in my Keurig, and tastes amazing!  I definitely would recommend it, especially if you don't like the stronger French Roast blends.

I was pleased with this brand of K-cup coffee.  Instead of coming in a small plastic (not very green!) container it comes in a mesh-like pouch making the coffee flow through it easier.  i have a hundred dollar Keurig machine and it stopped making coffee from the plastic containers.  Coffee everywhere.  i was ready to throw it out in disgust until i tried this new model of single brewing cup.  The taste is bold, although I prefer bolder, but it is fresh, dependable and works everytime.

I had given up on the Keurig after trying several different coffees as it always lacked in strength and flavor.  I had tried many varieties of the various branded versions of Green Mountain Coffee, aka all K-cups are packaged by Green Mountain.  I finally retired the brewer after the last bad cup having a distinct plastic taste, to a shelf in the basement. Then walking through Costco came across these pods, and different is better!  They seem to have more coffee grounds resulting in stronger coffee, are less expensive, and your beverage is not brewed through a plastic cup.  By far the best coffee for the Keurig and I am looking forward to trying some of the different roasts and blends and really glad to see they are available through Amazon Prime, as Costco is often there one minute gone the next trip.
I am a coffee fanatic.  This coffee is delicious!  As good if not better than other brands, and the price is reasonable.

We love our Keurig machine but found the kcups to be expensive. This brand of coffee offers a strong, bold cup of coffee and at a lower price point that most of the others.

We have the box of 80 delivered every month, very convenient.
I've tried a lot of different Keurig K cup and pod brands. This coffee is the best. And, I love the new style K kup. It's more effecient and more ECO friendly.

I hesitated buying these quasi K-cups fearing they would not have good flavor, not fit right or spew grounds into my cup.  All those concerns were unfounded!  I have tried just about every dark roast coffee put into a K-cup and this is the best and at half the price...that is called value.  I have purchased hundreds of items on Amazon and this is the first one I felt compelled to review because I assume others have the same "it is too go to be true" feeling that I had.  Now I am going to use the subscribe and save feature and save a little more.

This coffee is my all-time favorite, beating Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts.  The flavor is rich and bold.  The pod design is eco-friendly, the price CAN'T BE BEAT.  I will continue to order this item.  It is the best coffee I've ever had!
Awesome, San Francisco Bay French roast is the best.....without the bitter bite, dark  smooth......smells and tastes GREAT......we love it.....we will be buying more!

Quality taste at a great price -(especially with subscribe and save). Took a chance on something new and that looked a little different and I'm glad I did.  After I open a pouch of K-Cups, I put them in a zip-lock bag.  My cup of coffee is fresh and delicious.  Try it.  You'll like it.

I am not a coffee critic, but this is some dang good coffee.  Although I did not get it for the $28.00 others refernce, I did pay $33.00 and feel that is a good buy, at least $12.00 less than Sam's Club for what I feel is better coffee.  I like the little pods, will composts them when I decide to compost.

I've been a San Francisco Bay coffee fan for years, and was delighted to learn of their one-cups.  The flavor is great and the pods are eco-friendly.  I like my coffee strong and have found the French Roast to be just right.  Don't know what a reviewer meant by "weak and watery."  Not so!  I like the price too.
A truly tasty French roast and I love the the packaging--feels more like brewing coffee, allows savory aroma to waft.  Packs a caffeine punch yet delicious flavor. Will buy again.

I was so excited to try these in spite of all the negative reviews that tried to scare me away - maybe some folks were confused by the title however please note **these are not K Cups - they are One cup made to work with our beloved Keurig K-Cup Brewers.
Thank goodness - for any of you who have had to deal with that puff of air sending the K Cups coffee grounds up inside the Kuerig needle which after only one use can clog the needle. I thought I was going crazy going through the process of returning my Kuerig which was still full of water back to either Amazon or in my case Costco - because I thought it was just a lemon - yeah, did that 4 times -
The beauty of these little One Cup filters is that they are not vacuum sealed -
I keep mine in a large glass, clamp lidded jar.....The freshness is a divine improvement - and less waste in the landfill ...every little bit helps... So far, no bitter taste and I am loving these...

I have tried each of these New K-cup like items from San Francisco Bay. This one is darker than the Rainforest blend but not as dark as the Fog Chaser (my personal favorite).

Great coffee...great alternative!

I've been drinking this brand of coffee for many years. I was delighted to see them come out in a Keurig compatible form. Because they're not really "K-Cups" they don't have to pay the licensing fee, so they can sell for a lower price.

The One Cup pods deliver the exact same taste as the beans, a good rich French Roast.

Because these are pods and not sealed cups, they should be stored in an airtight container or they will go stale very rapidly. The box is subdivided into smaller sealed bags, each bag holds a few days worth of cups for the two of us at my house.

I like strong coffee. I should get that out of the way first, because I know not everyone appreciates deep, dark coffees. Aside from Dark Magic and Mahogany, this is better than almost every k-cup I have tasted.

I may be in the minority here, but I actually prefer the filter-like bottom of these pods over the k-cup for four reasons:

1. I've noticed no difference in freshness compared to the Nitrogen-filled, sealed k-cup.

2. I don't have to waste filtered water and keep a paper clip handy to unclog the coffee grounds that get stuck in the needle of the Keurig because of pressure and temperature differences between where the k-cup was sealed and where it gets punctured.

3. When brewing with these One Cups, the kitchen smells of freshly brewed coffee, an aroma I had missed when using k-cups.

4. (And I realize not everyone will feel this way) - warning, nothing but complaining ahead:

I had begun resenting being beholden to Keurig. I dutifully sent them money each month for k-cups and each month they found new ways to make me regret it. (Not shipping the k-cups out at all, allowing my package to sit in their warehouse for a week while they assured me it was on its way, consistently being out of stock of the k-cups I wanted and most of all, whenever I called or wrote to point out a problem, issuing a coupon code for free k-cups but then repeating the problem the following month. Their customer service dept is structured in a way that they repeat problems and never resolve anything.)

great cup of coffee. i MUST have these or else :) i am very fussy about my coffee. these are in a sealed bag, when opened a burst of fresh coffee hits you...which i never had with k cups. they are a whole new way of enjoying your keurig coffee makers. i sooooooooo highly recommend san francisco bay coffee ..especially french roast
These K Cups provided strong coffee without sediment in the bottom of the cup. I think the taste was deeper then the usual K cups and I felt better about not having the plastic on the bottom.

I was a little hesitant about ordering these after reading multiple reviews that talked about the foil breaking and spilling the grounds everywhere.  But I'm glad I went ahead and made the purchase.  The coffee tastes great and after getting almost completely through the first bag (12 "pods" in each amazon frustration-free package) I have been very happy.  No spillage and a great, strong and flavorful cup of coffee.

For the past year, I have had a monthly shipment of the Diedrich French Roast sent to my house.  When they discontinued the subscribe and save for that product I was very disappointed and had to find a new french roast.  After reading the reviews I decided to give the San Francisco Bay a try.  I was a bit skeptical about the package and I am very picky about taste, however, I just brewed my first cup and I love it!  It has a really rich flavor that seems to have more of the natural oils that you would find in a french press.  Sounds crazy, but it seems to be true!  The aroma is wonderful as well.  I haven't gotten to the end of my first cup quite yet so I don't know if there is more sediment, but hey, I like french press so a little sediment won't kill me.  I plan to make this coffee my new subscribe and save.

I love the beans, but this design of the cup is not good-- the cups are not sealed all the way and after the first few cups, the coffee starts to get stale unless you vacuum seal the k-cups.  I would say hold off on purchasing these unless you go through them quickly or can find a way to store them.

I thought that the flavor was good - it tasted more like a real cup of coffee - like one that was brewed traditionally. But this French roast was just too strong to me. Almost a little bitter.

I prefer the San Francisco Bay cup style over the plastic K-cup. And I will be trying a lighter roast.

These coffee pods work great in the Keurig Brewer, and if you like the flavors available these are a good value, but at our local warehouse club (BJ's New England) we got a box of 80 for around $28.00. This is way less than here at Amazon. I hope they create more flavors. As for the "off taste" other reviewers are complaining about this coffee is a branch of Peets Coffee. They roast a lot differently than Green Mountain Coffee, the people who bring you the Keurig brewers. I find the coffee to be robust and a lot less bitter than Starbucks, but more bitter than, say, a Dunkin Donuts coffee.

I would buy these again and again, but as I said, our local warehouse store had them for even less. Shop around!

I like strong coffee...I LOVE strong coffee and drink it black. This coffee is not really strong but it is quite bitter and has an odd taste to it. Reminds me of 8 o clock French Roast which I also do not like. If you like 8 o clock French Roast you will likely like this one. I like San Franciscos Fog Chaser much better and make it on the stongest setting of my brewer.

Love the pod design. Going to try the French Roast next.
I am a coffe snob and I admit it! This is great coffee!
Wonderful coffee at a great price!!! I haven't tried other beans, but the French roast is delicious. Happy to have auto ship too - keeps my keruig busy and my taste buds happy!
As others have written - a K-Cup knock off with nice full flavor - 10oz. setting is good for me - great value - nice bold flavor - best option I have tried so far.

I usually drink this in the af'noon and find it perfect mild bold drink using 1/2 the amount of water required. the aroma is wonderful and the brew flavors expand as you mull the first few sip around in your mouth..the wife also finds it her 2nd choice as Nantucket grabs her attentions 1st. This is not a Kpod but has a mesh bottom..thus I found it tended to lose floavor if not sealed in plastic bag...just an heads up for new customers.

Our favorite coffee is Donut Shop by Coffee People and we were curious with this new type of Kcup. Although not the same as Donut Shop this coffee has a wonderful flavor. If you like a strong full bodied flavor use the middle setting otherwise the 10 ounce setting will still give you a very full bodied coffee without being watered down. All in all we will definitely be ordering this again. The best at .44 cents a cup this is a great value.

I tried this coffee because of the price being less than most k-cups here on Amazon. It's very strong coffee using the largest setting on our B-60 (I think it's 9.25 oz.). Taste is not full-bodied but rather ashy tasting and flat; it smells and tastes like cigarettes and coffee.
Also, I have to hold the machine closed while it's brewing. The strange non-k-cup pod will not allow the machine to close properly. The pods need to be stored in a ziploc or other airtight container. I'd have appreciated knowing they were not standard k-cups in advance.
I won't re-order despite the savings.

I purchased this product because the pods looked like they were made in a more earth friendly way. There's no hard plastic cup involved. We break down our cups after use. We compost the coffee and recycle the foil tops. The plastic cups end up in the garbage.
This product arrives in several heavy plastic bags for freshness. The filter pods are synthetic so they can't be composted and the tops seem to be made of plastic, not foil. The only thing I can keep out of the garbage is the coffee itself.
The coffee tastes good.

I sort of like the built-in filter bag instead of the usual plastic container, and the plastic bag.  The taste, for me, is a little more bitter and less pleasant than the other French Roast coffees offered through Amazon.
San Francisco Bay French Roast coffee has a great taste--full-bodied with no bitter aftertaste.  The K-cups appear to be more environmentally friendly than other K cups.
San Francisco Bay French Roast coffee for keurig is one of the best k-cup coffee I have tried.  I recommend it to anyone who prefers the strong flavor of french roast coffee.

I was surprised when I saw the "kups", but I had nothing to be concerned about.  The little bags of coffee are very sturdy and the coffee is very good.  In fact the coffee is stronger than the other kups,  I much prefer these bags.  And monthly delivery is perfect.
Ok so you know the pack is smaller... but dont get too dissapointed it is a strong cup of coffee  will make you go for a while befor you will want anther 1 i am a fan.

I was happy to see these new K-Cup designs because they're at a much better price point than the original K-Cups.  I tried the San Francisco Bay Coffee's French Roast because I like a really dark and flavorful cup of coffee.  Since I also almost always use the large cup setting when I brew my coffee, I want a coffee that gives as much flavor as possible.  I was not disappointed!  The French Roast has a very bold flavor while not being acidic or bitter.  I'll definitely be ordering more!

This is a heads up for those who like strong, fresh, French Roast coffee... It will not be found with these K-Cups.

Freshness. The coffee in each individual K-Cup is not sealed from air. While other brands have a plastic cup and a sealed top, the base on these Cups is the coffee filter. Secondly, all of the K-Cups are packaged together in a single plastic bag. Once that bag is opened, the unused K-Cups become exposed to air. I placed my remaining K-Cups in an sealed container.

Coffee Quality. The taste is good but the strength is less than Starbucks French Roast. While the packaging indicates a very deep roast, I did not experience that strength. If a mild French Roast brew is desired, then this coffee should work fine.
Different look but works just fine in my maker.  I love the French Roast flavor.  I will definitely buy again.
Just tried this coffee a few days ago and love it!  I like my coffee strong (will enjoy a dopio every now and then).  This coffee is strong and smooth.  I can't ask for more.

Like many Keurig users, I have been frustrated by the lack of choices in K-cup vendors. That is, while there are many types of coffees available, only Green Mountain can make the K-cup because of their patent. Pricing has been held fairly high and steady. It would be nice to have a choice and better pricing.

The SF Bay coffee appears to be a good alternative. I have used it for 2 weeks and it seems to be compatible with the Keurig machine. The coffee taste is good. I prefer a stronger taste and am ok with it a bit more bitter. As a frame of reference, I find the average 7 oz cup too weak and use the 3 or 5oz setting.

As others have noted, the coffee comes in small bags of 8 "pods" each. You have to put the open bag in a ziploc bag for storage because the coffee in the pods is exposed in the filter.

I really like the price of the SF Bay coffee. It is good value and feel like I have a choice.

I am not a SF Bay employee or shareholder. I just want reasonable pricing and choice.

We picked these up at our warehouse club store... They are under forty cents per cup. Delicious, dark roast. I love the fact that each k-cup has an exposed filter rather than the plastic cups. We will be sticking to these!

I bought this at a local HEB in Texas for $6.99 and was skeptical but alas! this is great in my Platinum Keurig. I had decided not to use k cups anymore because the price is over the top but these will keep me going until Keurig prices come down! I brewed on the 10 oz setting and is VERY bold for me, I wwas even able to add more water through it because it was too bold for me. Love that it doesnt use all the plastic too...

Coffee is fine. But I won't buy again. As another reviewer reported, this is not a standard K-Cup design. Simply a paper filter below a plastic collar. Shorter than a K-Cup, so doesn't come in contact with the bottom punch. Water flows through the filter and into the cup . . . albeit at a faster rate than being forced through the small bottom hole of the standard K-Cup. Do not attempt to brew a large cup, it will be too watery.

Twelve servings come packed in a vacuum packed plastic bag. When you open the bag, all twelve containers are exposed, so you'll need to repackage them in a zip-lock bag if you want to keep them fresh. They do not fit in the standard K-Cup carousel.

This coffee was not as good and rich I hoped-leaves a bitter taste even when sugar is added.  Also when op;en the package containing pods, the coffee is exposed to the air-only has a filter around it so smells nice in the coffee drawer of your kitchen.

I found the coffee to be a little to strong for my taste. Many times I had to let the pod
go a second time to get the coffee I like
My husband is very fussy about his coffee and this one is the one he likes best.  Very robust taste.

I like these for a couple of reasons. First, the coffee is very good. I like a dark, rich roast and if I put this on the smallest setting for my Keurig brewer, I get a cup comparable to when I go to my favorite local coffee house.
Second, I like that they are little pouches rather than the k-cup - less plastic, less waste. And I've never had one leak coffee grounds.
The one drawback, as some have commented is that they may go stale faster. They are sold in boxes of 12 (Amazon sells you 3 of those boxes at a time), so as long as you just open one at a time and you finish the box within two weeks, it is not a concern - at least I have had no problem with staleness!
They are also less expensive with the Subscribe and Save - a win-win all around!

This is great coffee! Delicious flavor,a little on the strong side for those who like it strong.Love the cups- no extra plastic that goes into the land fills!!! This is a great idea for a k-cup. Keep up the good work !!!!!!

I bought this thinking it was a good deal, and I remember in my Keurig brewer's sampler pack that I like the french roast cups.  So, I ordered this "deal".  Do not buy this burnt, after-tasting, muddy coffee!!  Not worth the pennies saved.
sorry, but this coffee was a little too roasted for me, even thoughts of burnt coffee go through my mind.  I'm using it up, but not for fixing my friends a cup of coffee

Being a huge fan of the "subscribe and save" program through Amazon, I decided to add coffee to an ever growing list of products delivered.  This coffee, however, is the worst my husband and I have ever tried!  Beware.

THIS COFFEE TASTES GREAT BEST VALUE FOR KERIG SYSTEM ONE THING YOU MUST DO WITH THIS COFFEE AFTER UNPACKING IS PUT IT IN A PLASTIC BAG TO KEEP FRESH YOU MUST KEEP THE AIR OUT DONT PUT IT IN THE FRIGE KEEP IT ROOM TEMP IF YOU ARE A COFFEE EXPERT LIKE ME YOU WILL LOVE THIS COFFEE RICH FLAVOR ALL FLAVORS ARE GREAT EVEN THE DECAF YOU WILL SAVE AROUND 10 CENTS TO 12 CENTS PER POD LEAVE IT TO AMAZON TO BRING US THIS GREAT COFFEE I AM A PRIME MEMBER I SAVE ON SHIPPING AND HANDILING BECOME A PRIME MEMBER AND SAVE WAY TO GO AMAZON

This is the WORST coffee I have had in years.  Either they do not know what French Roast is or someone really messed up.  I put cream in my coffee so at least I can taste that.  Avoid this brew! Does not deserve any "Stars" because it cannot be coffee.
I thought that this was a great idea for a K-Cup...still do...but after one cup we threw the rest of it away...oh my!

The Rogers Family Company continues to be a tremendous supporters of local schools. As Principal of Jefferson Elementary, I appreciate the kindness and generosity this company has shown us. A few years back they donated $10,000 to our school and most recently they provided our staff a one cup coffee maker and samples of these wonderful Keurig coffees. My favorite is the French Roast. Strong flavor with a smooth finish. Please support this company by purchasing their coffee.

This is without a doubt the worst coffee I ever tasted!  The only reason I ever tried a box of this coffee is that the "wonderful" people at Amazon canceled my subscribe and save item of Diedrich french roast.This coffee even smells horrible right out of the box.

Not going to mince many words on this terrible coffee.  It is substantially inferior to a K-cup or Solofill/My-K-Kup as it leaves a LOT of mud in the cup with your coffee.  It's over-roasted, having a burnt, ashtray-flavored quality.  Very disappointed with the product.
I have never had coffee as bad as this. If you like bitter flavorless coffee maybe this is for you. I am very disappointed and would not buy it again at any price.
Save yourself from trying these k-cups - not a good substitute for the typical ones, like the ones from Green Mountain.  Bitter taste and unpleasant after taste as well.  Not worth it at all.

Gave them a try.

It does brew a cup of coffee but not with the same quality taste as the K-Cup.

The difference is not brewing the coffee in the K -Cup is evident in taste,

It is a patent work around that for me is not worth what frankly is a trivial cost savings.

Yes, sometimes quality matters.

This coffee is awful, very bitter, and I have had others taste it, my sister and my husband, its not drinkable. I wanted to return it, but its grocery, so I am stuck with it. Very disappointing. I bought it because it had good reviews and a great price.
these arent k-cups but can be used in a keurig and go stale, they are getting sued by gmcr for a patent violation

These Kcups?? were flimsy imitation want a bees and were not what I expected at all.  Very disappointed and will not fall for that again.  The coffee was weak and the containers split.  I threw them out after trying a couple.

I tried it when it arrived and did not like it. I tried to send the other unopened bags back but that request was was denied by Amazon. I tried to drink it when we ran out of our reg k-cups and we waiting on the new delivery, it was all I had in the house and I still could not drink it. I gave it all away. The man of house also could not drink it. If you order it for the price as I did, beware if you are somewhat spoiled by good coffee. I am a fan of most Starbucks products, although I am not crazy about the Starbucks k-cups. We have been drinking the Donut Shop K-cups forever. I also like Green Mountain breakfast blend. I spend over $50.00 a month just on Donut Shop K-cups.
This was the most disappointing coffee I've gotten for the Kcup. The only way I was able to drink it was to add milk and chocolate syrup to it to cover the taste. Not good.

I love my k-cups and this is the worst I have ever tasted!  I thought most of the reviews sound good....so give it a chance...after a few sips, I threw the entire 36 cups into the trash! Don't listen to the rave reviews...stick to brands you already know and love!

The cups are smaller and hold less coffee than the competitors. They also are not airtight so will degrade once the package is opened unless used quickly. But even if used quickly they are weak and watery. Actually, more like dishwater. They should come with a warning label. I would have wanted to know that they were weak and watery by design.
Open air cups - not a good idea. Better off with real K cups.  Open air cups - not a good idea. Better off with real K cups.

I could smell the aroma of this french roast coffee when I took off the plastic covering the box. It smelled wonderful.
It was just as good when brewed.
I like that the pods are not solid plastic and take up less room in the trash and hopefully less room in the landfill.
Good product.
This is a great coffee. Dark and smoky without being bitter. Combine great taste with a great price and you really have a winner!  The decaf is really good too!

These pods work great.  I usually drink emerals, double black diamond, and recently newmans.  All of these are extra bold and dark. I brew 10oz.  I was concerned about weak coffee body and flavor.  These cups are definitely worth trying.  You won't be disappointed.  The 10oz came out great!

A good, strong French Roast with a smooth mouthfeel and no bitter finish. Definitely planning to try San Francisco Bay's other products. I love how much less plastic is wasted. (My Keurig is my best friend, but there's so much waste in most disposable K-Cups!)

I have been using kcups for a few years now and recently discovered these. I was sceptical but decided to try the SF Bay French Roast, Fog Chaser and Rainforest blends. I generally like strong, dark blends like emerils or dark magic. Overall, all 3 of the SF Bay blends are really good. The French Roast is my favorite though. It is strong and has a rich flavor and is not bitter. The fog chaser is STRONG and a bit bitter. The Rainforest is a bit less strong and has a slight bitterness. All are good strong blends but I like the richness of the French Roast. Overall these are really good and are much cheaper than "traditional" kcups which is an added bonus.
better for the environment with less packaging and by far the best priced keurig cup now. Costco is 8 dollars cheaper though on the 80 pack

I was fascinated by the description of these new K-cups and decided to take a chance after reading the reviews. I am very pleasantly surprised at the wonderfully flavorful coffee that they made! I am very particular about my coffee and like only very dark flavorful roasts. I had not really been pleased with any of the K-cups--some of course were better than others--and had pretty much settled on Starbucks Verona as my favorite, but these are better! (And--MUCH less expensive!)
My Keurig Platinum is at my beach home (only weekend usage and not every weekend at that!) so I was a bit concerned about this style K-cup staying fresh once the individual bag was opened. A bag ended up staying very fresh for several weeks--of course I resealed the bag with a couple of clips as well as I could--so this is no longer a concern of mine. I will be a regular consumer!

This is decidedly the best K-cup coffe I ever had. Before I tried this one, my k-cup carousel was a multi-colored mess with samples from variety of k-cups; from green mtn breakfast blend (just OK) to Emeril's dark roast (fairly decent) to Kona blend (terrible). Now with SF Bay french roast, I dont even need the carousel. These cups stay fresh in their original packaging. The taste is just the way I like it - strong but not bitter. Just a great coffee.

Bought this because it was suggested to me via email from Amazon. So disappointed! I love bold, dark coffees (French Roast from Tully's, Green Mountain, etc), but this tastes like an ash tray.

Gave it two stars because the more environmentally friendly design is clever. Otherwise, it would have been one star for sure.
Robust, full-bodied and delightful. If you like deep, rich complex coffee, this is the perfect blend for you! Appreciate the reduced eco-friendly packaging too. Added to my Subscribe & Save account.

I bought this coffee without reading through the description thoroughly, so when they arrived minus the plastic cup I was used to I was shocked and ready to send them back.  But I decided to give them a try and I have to say that there is no difference between these and the regular Kcups.  The coffee is rich and full bodied and I like the fact that they are a little more environmentally friendly that the regular plastic cups.  I will and actually have ordered them again.  I normally use my adapter for my bagged coffee, but when I am in a hurry (or for my husband who would rather not fool with the adapter) I use the occasional K cup, or this kind now that I have tried them!

I will start off saying i'm not a coffee snob, but I think these are great. For the price they can't be beat- and we keep them in a mason jar on the counter (so cute!) to keep them fresh. my husband also said they are easier to prepare to go into the compost pile.
Any reservations on this, please order them and try! what will you be out? with ship and save only $13.50.

Bought a Keurig last year but have struggled to find decent coffee.  We finally resorted to the little refillable thing but it was a mess and a hassle.  We've always enjoyed SF Bay Coffee and these pods are wonderful.  The quality of the coffee is SO much better than anything else we've tried.  Not sure about those negative reviews--nothing watery or dishwatery about the cups we are brewing.  I like the packaging much better as well, I don't want things I consume touching all that plastic that is getting heated up.  The French Roast is perfect in the morning and the Rainforest Blend is wonderful too.  The Company has also made a big commitment to the communities where their coffee is grown, including fair trade and sustainable ventures.

I found that not only was keeping these pods fresh by keeping them in zip locks bags a pain, but that this roast was really too bold for me.
I can't get anyone at home or work to drink these.
I will stick with Green Mountain Nantucket blend in the future.

Please see my complete review for all the San Francisco blends under the Rainforest blend. Except I forgot to mention the Fog Lifter
I would put in the little lighter than this French Roast, which I believe is the best Bold I have tried.
San Francisco Brand is the only K-cup brand we purchase now that we have found all the PLUSES!

The trouble I find with a lot of the Kuerig cups is that I like my coffee strong and most cups aren't strong enough if I want a full cup of coffee without using two cups at a lower volume. With these, I get the strength I want with just one.

The concept for packaging this coffee was great. Simply putting the coffees in a ziploc bag preserved their freshness and the idea that I was putting less plastic in our local landfill was great as I live in a little village on the Yukon River.

However, I found this roast to have a very bitter aftertaste. I generally enjoy a full, dark roast and I like the bitterness of coffee. That's the whole point. But I was really unhappy with the finish in this particular French Roast and won't purchase it again. I am slowly working my way through the 80 count I bought, on days when I have a taste for added creamer flavors. This isn't a comment on any of the other San Fransisco Bay products, as I haven't tried them, just this particular roast.

I love the fact that this delicious, strong K-cup ready coffee comes with an exposed filter. I'd been trying to cut the bottoms off of the K-cups I had been using, in order to recycle them. (good intentions, but not realistic!) The fact that they don't even have the bottom portion of the "regular" K-cups while still maintaining excellent, rich flavor makes me a convert.

This flavor, French Roast, is bold, strong and just what I'm looking for as a morning coffee, and holds up very well as iced coffee as well.

I'll be buying many more of these!

Coffee is bold and very good. I like it better than Newman s and Folgers K-Cups. It is a bargain for the price. Also it is great that the "cups" are not plastic but just a filter :)My favorite k-kup for sure!

I tried these alternative k-cups for the first time and thought they were pretty good. I don't think I'll be buying the traditional k-cups again. The French Roast were nice and dark roasted.

My 80-pack came with 10 bags of 8 pods. When I opened a bag I put the ones I wasn't going to use right then in a ziplock bag. Not much hassle to save 50% on the cost of k-cups.

After reading the reviews we jumped in with both feet and ordered this and the Fog Chaser. Here's my take on the French Roast after drinking all 36 cups:
* I prefer this to the Fog Chaser, but I like a darker roast.
* Don't be scared by the look, it's just a K-Cup without the plastic case. I love that this seems more eco-friendly.
* Okay, it's true, they smell a little funny. Not quite sure why they don't just smell like coffee, but who knows what other K-cups smell like without the plastic cover, right? Our solution was just not to smell them before brewing.
* The taste is bold, and my first cup tasted bitter and not so great. We don't use sugar or sweeteners so there was nothing to mask the taste! But, like most new things, after a couple of cups over a couple of mornings I found the taste was fine, especially for the price. I don't know if I would serve this to company though, I like really dark roasts but most people don't.
* I read a tip that said to prevent grounds in your cup, close the brewer lid slowly and gently. Works for us, we've had NO grounds in our cups.
So there we go, I'm ordering them again to take advantage of the Subscribe & Save option. I'm not going to say that this is the best coffee I've ever had, but for that 1st cup in the morning it's just fine.

Love this coffee and love the price!I love the smell when I open the container and it is my new favorite coffee. I would recommend this to anyone. I keep it in a zip lock bag after opening to keep it fresh until used.

I did not buy these from Amazon, but apparently will in the future. I was in my local membership-required-big-box store (am I allowed to say Costco?) when I saw this stuff for about 27 cents per serving. Since it's very easy to return stuff there, I bought it. As others have commented, it's unusual looking, in that just the familiar looking K-Cup ring and foil at the top are there. The plastic cup around the bottom is missing. But that doesn't matter and it actually creates less waste and probably costs less to manufacture.

Off course, being green doesn't matter if the coffee tastes bad. In this case, it does not. It's got to be one of the two best French Roast K-Cups I have ever had. Full of flavor, without being bitter or burnt. I went back to the store a few days later and they had sold out and they are not sure of plans to get more, so it looks like I will continue to buy my coffee from Amazon, but instead of my usuall brand (Green Mountain French Roast), I will be buying these.
These K-Cups arrived promptly after ordering; the are convenient to use, and the coffee tastes great. Highly recommend the product. Have had no problems.

This has become our daily coffee. We were previously Starbucks (brewed at home) coffee drinkers, although I will say these are not quite as strong as Starbucks brewed coffee...not weak either though. I usually buy them at our local wholesale warehouse, where the price is a little better, but I come to Amazon when I am needing it fast and don't have time to go to the store. It makes a good cup of coffee, that I happily serve to guests. The only down side is that the individual packaging does not allow for display. Not a big deal.

The coffee is very good.  The cup looks different than the standard k-cup but who care as long as the coffee is good and cost effective. With monthly subscription,  it saves me about $10 a month for regular drinking for 1 person.  Do the math if you have more people drinking.  Recommend the coffee and subscription

We purchase on Subscribe and Save, 3 boxes a month.  I like the little filters instead of the pods. The price is great. My husband thinks the coffee is stronger than our previous French Roast.  However I really like the robust flavor and, at this price, he just adds a little more cream.  If this had resealable bag I would give four stars. We had to buy a large airtight jar.

I like this coffee and the design of the cup. Not the same as a K-cup but works just as good. I like the Fog Chaser better than the French Roast but this is a pretty good tasting one too. Can't beat the price..15.99 for 36 is much cheaper than any other on Amazon.

I was surprised when I got these from Amazon because like the other reviewers said, the cups do not look like traditional K-Cups, because the bottom of the cup is a filter - not plastic like the traditional ones. But don't let this bother you - they worked just fine.

The coffee was better than most - strong flavor. One of the better stronger brews.

The only issue I see is that after you open the package, you must use the cups quickly or they will get stale. Some people like the K-Cups because they don't use that much coffee and so it is always fresh. But if you are like me and drink a lot of coffee, I don't see how you can go wrong with this coffee.

I'm a coffee lover and enjoy all kinds but now drink k-cup most of time.

This one is really tasty French roast, better than any other French roast.
It's packed a bit different shaped container, but usage is same with other K-cups.
Also it smells good too and the rich taste remains in the mouth longer.
Price is also good comapred to other K-cups.

One problem is it has too much of black resides at the bottom of cup.
Good taste all the way but at the end I have to be careful not to drink residues. It definitely needs improvement for filtration.
Due to too much remnants, I would not buy this again.

This coffee had all the rich flavor that I expect from a dark roast and minimal bitterness. I suspect most folks are checking these reviews to find out if these weird cups actually work in a Keurig machine. They do. I had no issues. The unexpected benefit was the great coffee aroma. I love the Keurig system, but I miss the smell of coffee before it is prepared. The aroma is back with these as soon as you open the plastic bag that they come in. As much as I enjoyed the aroma, I felt compelled to store these things in another air-tight container, lest they lose their freshness. I also decided that I could not keep these cups in the rotary K-cup holder that we keep next to our machine.

Despite storage issues, I would get these again for their flavor, aroma, and price.

Function: these cupless k-cups work perfectly in our Keurig B130 (the business version of the small personal brewer) which makes only a small cup.

Less waste: We were really disappointed when we discovered that the plastic k-cups aren't recyclable. These are a terrific low-guilt, more responsible alternative.

Less storage space: they take up much less room to store. I buy k-cups in quantity to save money, but then I had to dedicate a large cabinet to storing them! Not so with these, partially because they're less bulky and partially because...

Great Price: these k-cups are much less expensive than other brands, especially at the Subscribe & Save price. At this price, I can buy less at a time and still pay less per cup than I could finagle with coupons & sales & bargain-shopping the major brands.

Taste: Amazing! I love a good dark French roast, and these are the best I've ever had. Dark & rich but not bitter. In fact, this morning I forgot to pour the creamer before I took a sip and I was amazed that it tasted really great. I've tried to go without creamer before - I'd like to get used to coffee without it - but could never stand to...until I did it by mistake this morning and it was so smooth I drank the whole cup that way. Trust me, this speaks volumes.

Conclusion: I'm keeping my subscription, and I just increased the frequency of my deliveries because we found we drink these more than the regular k-cups. How can you beat cheap, tasty, less bulky, and less waste?

This coffee is very good, it has a nice aroma and a good strong flavor.

I also like the "minimalist" k-cup design, but have a couple complaints with it. Since the individual pods aren't sealed, you have to keep them in a sealed package to prevent spoilage. It would have been nice if the plastic bag they came in was re-sealable.
Also, since the coffee doesn't just come out of a small hole in the bottom of the pod, the first cup you make with these will wash all the stray grounds out of your machine and into your cup. Be forewarned that you should wash the pod holder before using these.

Overall I like the product, just be careful about the different pod shape.

This hot sauce is not to overwhelming and has a nice garlicky flavor to it. Awesome taste or the Moruga in there, this hot sauce is liquidy so it had the dot plastic thingy in the middle. I put it on everything and i would definitely order more.

This is way too sweet and artificially fizzy.  Somehow the pasturization process took out the goodness of the real Kombuchas. I've found that GT's Synergy is one of the best.  It also contains raw Chia, an outstanding energy food. Watch out for others, like this Wonder Drink, that try to use the same words and imitate the quality companies that produce Kombucha the way it is meant to be drank. Find one of the GT's Kombucha products and compare for yourself.

This drink is tasty and made with some pretty simple and natural ingredients. However, carbonation is added (in true kombucha it is a natural part of fermentation) and the drink is obviously pasteurized, which destroys any live culture (and thusly the probiotics that make kombucha popular as a health drink).
Very good  and arrived on time.  I will order this product again for me and my husband's use.  Very health product too.

First, this is a poor-tasting kombucha.  Worse, "Wonder Drink" Pasteurizes all of their products, eliminating any live cultures and therefore much of the reason to drink kombucha in the first place.  I do not recommend this product, and hope that Amazon carries a real kombucha in the future.
This product exceeded expectation, makes you feel better after drinking.  Will buy again.  Thank you Dr. Oz for talking about it on your show!

Although possibly not a true Kombucha, although I am not a pro on the subject, the taste is great.  I have had the hard core kombucha and it took some getting use to, but filled with probiotics and other essentials.  This is a good introduction to the whole kombucha thing.  I'd probably read up to see just how valuable it is compared to other kombuchas.  Price is fair and shipping was relatively fast.
I DID NOT LIKE IT. IT MADE ME COUGH EVERY DRINK OF IT & DID NOT TASTE GOOD I HAVE NOTHING MORE TO SAY ABOUT IT...

Do Not Buy!
I bought this case of 12 bottles 2 months ago and have consumed a few of them. At first I noticed that the bottle looked different than the ones I've seen before. The bottles are opaque instead of the clear plastic I have seen in the past and is pictured. Secondly I thought the taste wasn't as strong as I had remembered but I didn't have any other mustard to compare it to. The more I used it the more convinced I became that it was not truly Grey Poupon since it just tasted like cheap dijon mustard to me. At Christmas I received a jar of real Grey Poupon and compared the two, no question they are not the same. I cannot return this item and I have used a few bottles. I would not buy again and I would not recommend it to anyone.
One note, I purchased this product through Amazon but Sold by: J&M Goods, LLC
Not sure if that makes any difference now you can buy direct.

Got a 6 ounce bag at Wal-Mart for about two bucks.  Stands to reason you can get a quantity for a big discount?  Just look at the price of these seeds.  Way too much money.  No thank you.  Nutsonline has got better deals.

These roasted little gems are a must have if you are on a low carbohydrate diet, or if you just want a snack that won't spike your blood sugar but still is nice and crunchy and satisfying.  I tried the salted version but I am tempted now to try some of their other flavors.

These are better than the other brands I have tried. Most have an ingredients list along the lines of "Pumpkin seeds, salt, (maybe some kind of oil)" and that's it, and usually taste as bland as paper to me. I like salt, nay...I love salt. These have a nice roasted flavor, and salt you can actually taste. They are not overly salty tasting, you don't feel the salt on your fingers, and there isn't a layer of salt in the bottom of the bag like you see in a bag of pretzels. It was nice not to have to get out the salt shaker and dump some in the bag.

I wound up eating nearly a whole bag in one sitting. If you like nuts and seeds, and enjoy a tasty salty snack then you will most definetly like these.

I love this peanut butter, but suprise suprise, so do my kids!  I have always bought the large container of the jiffy/skippy brands from costco, but wanted to get away from the hydrongenated oils and excessive sugar.  I still wanted it to taste good, be smooth and not seperate like the high end organic food stores.  This is a great alternative, and I feel better feeding it to my kids.
Very happy with the quality and value of this peanut butter.  I dont really like that there is sugar added, but at least its not corn syrup or trans fat.

I love that this is a no-stir natural peanut butter. It has no trans fats and no cholesterol, no hydrogenated oil and no high fructose corn syrup. What I didn't expect was the extra sweetness provided by the evaporated cane juice and palm fruit oil. I prefer pure, ground peanuts. Nevertheless, I would purchase this again. I think children would probably prefer it over natural, oily p.b. too.
We love this PB! its the best out there, and we order this online be cause it is often out of stock at our local grocery.
I love, love this PB!! Its so smooth and taste so good don't even need jelly with it its so good!

I don't know about you, but when I go looking for a product that explicitly states it has no added sugar, I mean sugar in the general, anything-that-is-chemically-sugar sense. These folks make the "no added sugar" claim, and then follow it up with (oh by the way) "a little bit of cane juice for sweetness." Which is to say, added sugar. 3 grams per serving, in fact, if my online search for this product's nutritional information is correct.

Who are these people, unemployed politicians?

I'm sticking with the Fifty50 brand. Not only are they not lying through their teeth about not adding sugar, but they also donate half their profits to Diabetes research.

The place where I get most of my essential oils from has started to sell these Himalayan salt diffusers. They had little jars filled with olive size pink salt and you pour the oil over them, close the lid when not in use. I thought I could do that myself. I found these on Amazon, just what I was looking for. Perfect size and price.  The salt does not influence the fragrance of the oils at all, the perfect diffuser. I even will smash some with a hammer for my salt grinder. Spice Lab shipped it out quickly, very happy with the product and Spice Lab.

The flavors in the chocolates are only outdone by their beauty. They a soo good! I know the chef, he trained in Switzerland to learn how to make these, and you can tell. They melt in your mouth and rival any "name brand" out there.

I have loved chocolate my whole life and have sought out many types.  This chocolate is smooth, creamy and delicious.  It's hard to put the box down.  I am spoiled for other chcolates!! I highly recomend them to others.

I have English Cocker Spaniels who are allergic to grain. These are GREAT! I have ordered them before and never seem to have enough. My dogs are VERY happy campers. Healthy ingredients and taste good too! They will obey any command I request when they know these treats are available. Wet tongues and wiggle bodies make my heartstrings sing!Northern Biscuit Grain-Free Honey Glazed Duck w/ Real Papaya Dog Treat
Is this for 10LB Case of Jelly Belly Tutti Frutti Jelly Beans or is this for what the picture shows "Baby Flash Pop"... Please change picture or description, very misleading... thank you.

My wife and I used to eat these all the time back when I lived in Central Illinois. Strangely, when I moved to Chicagoland, we couldn't find them any more. So, I was thrilled to discover I could get them from Amazon.

These are incredibly tasty. And, unlike many other brands, they are free of trans fats. My only criticism is that they're a bit more fragile than some other brands, especially after heating them in the over per the package directions. You have to be careful biting into them to prevent your entire taco from falling apart. If they were a bit more robust, I'd give them 5 stars.

One thing to note: being preservative-free, they have a relatively short shelf life. The case I got from Amazon had a "best by" date about 3 months in the future. So, before ordering 12 boxes, make sure that you can go through at least a box per week.

This was the best $18.00 I ever spent on a box.  I ate that box so fast I was dizzy.  I was skeptical about ordering a box online but there wasn't anything too fishy about this one so I just went to town on it.  I spilled some on the carpet but the dog came over to clean it up.  Whoah, Sparky! That's for me!

Amara is a great product.  It tastes delicious, not fruity and is lo cal.  A perfect beverage after working out.  Red Bull and Monster are so heavy...like a weight in your stomach.  Amara is a refreshing recovery beverage.  Who wants to fill full after a workout?  Not me!

I have never really liked the taste of redbull or monster (too weird and tangy) but Amara is delicious. It has great flavor with just enough kick to keep you moving.  I drink it solo and have also used it as a mixer - goes great with vodka.  Will definitely order more.

A great disappointment. Having read about the excellence of vintage Pernod products, I was eager to try their modern concoction.

What a fall from Grace! Not only the green color of the drink is obviously artificial; when louched, the potent green is still present, making the final product greenish instead of the white it should be. You can only taste a strong anise flavor, and a burning sensation when you are finished. No hint of wormwood at all!

I would not recommend this absinthe even to beginners. Don't waste your money on this one.

P.S. I refuse to discuss thujone content and other non-sense and myths in my reviews. If you are interested in thujone, go eat sage and forget absinthe altogether.
Ok, so 24 16.9 oz bottles for $49.95. I pay $0.88 or $1.25 for my 2 liter bottle (depending on the promotions). Therefore, 24 x 16.9 oz bottles cost only around $11-$15.

This is one food that when mixed with their dry food, my dogs will eat every last drop. They love this. Our older dog (just turned 2) needs to be on a grain free diet, so that is what our puppy gets too. I love that this is 95% Turkey and that the dogs really like it.

My parents were having issues getting their Yorkie to eat Wellness dry and so was I with my Yorkie. They would eventually eat, but it was dragging down their routines. According to the Whole Dog Journal, Wellness Canned Dog Food Chicken and Sweet Potato Recipe is a great food for your dog. The article stressed how gone are the days where wet food was worse for a dog than dry. As long as it's a good, quality food, the wet is actually better for dogs than the dry. I mix the wet with the dry and our Yorkies lap it down quick. I can also hide my Yorkie's morning pill with it and she doesn't realize she's taking her medicine.

I have been involved in dog rescue for many years. I recently took in a very large hound who had been starved within an inch of his life. The vet recommended this (in addition to many other treatments and holistic measures, including yogurt!) to try to quickly get some weight on and good nutrition into the dog. You'd think a starving dog would eat anything, but often times they will not. I had to bake this hound homemade meatloaf for a month. Wellness and Nutro canned were the only "dog foods" I could get him to eat. But he did gain weight steadily, was able to wean off 'human food', and did very well.  After gaining 20 lbs, he was adopted by a wonderful family. When you need the best, any of the Wellness Brands I would highly recommend.

My pups LOVE this food! WELLNESS products have consistently proven to be top of the line food for dogs and cats and their Chicken Stew is no exception!
This is so well made and although the sauce is kinda slimy, it is a healthy slimy and one that nourishes my dearest of creatures! Please note that this food is not meant as a dish all unto itself, but rather, it is a food topper to go with dry food nuggets. Together the nutrition abounds!

I like the fact that Wellness offers grain free all meat canned and limited ingredient allergy dry food. Unfortunately my old dog has serious skin issues that Wellness also did not seem to correct so I have decided to take him off commercial foods completely and he now eats only organic human grade freeze dried artisan dog food. Wellness dog food is probably one of the better choices if you feed your dog commercial foods so I recommend this product over other cheaper commercial brand names. Amazon prices are the best and shipping to Maui excellent.

The ratings for this food are among the highest and my Labrador LOVES this stuff!  I feel very good giving him this high quality food and am glad that my picky eater wants something that is so good for him.  It's chunky and you can see peas, carrots, potato, and, of course, the chunks of meat.  I highly recommend this product!

I thought I would try this stuff for my finicky dog who needs moist food along with his kibble.  He was not a big fan of it and it was the most expensive moist food at Petsmart.  The other problem is this stuff hardens up like concrete in his bowl. If he wouldn't eat the food in about two hours the stuff turned as hard as a sidewalk and I had to literally scrape it out of his bowl.

WE FOUND THIS DOG FOOD ONLINE AND COULDN'T BELIEVE THAT IT WAS 95% BEEF WITH NO FILLERS! THIS IS HARD TO BEAT FOR PET FOOD. OUR GUYS LOVE THIS FOOD AND IT IS NICE TO KNOW IT ISN'T FILLED WITH JUNK. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS FOOD.

I just got my 1yr old shihtzu the turkey and she loves it. I mix it with her dry food. It does have a gel substance around the food. I just mix the entire can up gel and all and put it in a small tupperware container. I put left overs in the fridge. My extremely picky girl had her nose in the can while I was trying to scoop the food out. She licked her bowl clean. So happy I found this stuff. Also it actually smells good. I didn't think it smelled at all. My girl is allergic to chicken so I was very happy to find wellness made several flavors without any chicken and grain free. Highly recommend this dog food.

Had my big noble boy dog, who had been with me for ten years, die of Cancer recently. He was a animal shelter rescue (As all my pets have been, and are.), and a great creature who never wanted to ever show weakness. By the time he did show weakness, the Cancer was far too advanced to operate on or save him and he died within a month.

That set me to feeding my two dogs (His mate who is still with me, and her new mate) ONLY quality dog food. It costs more; but after seeing what was in the average store dog food on internet posts, and confirmed on dog food cans labels, that convinced me to try something better.

I researched the net for the top ten dog foods, and this brand kept coming up in the lists consistently; including Veterinary sites. Made only with grain free quality ingredients,and other healthy additions for good digestion, my two dogs eat it enthusiastically, and I highly recommend it.

Both dogs are fed Wellness brand "Beef Stew" and Wellness brand "Lamb and Beef Stew", alternating for variety in their diets; they love both equally, and both canned foods are equally healthy.

I've been feeding Wellness food to my Chihuahua for nearly a year and she loves it. She dances around eager for her breakfast when I start scooping it into her dish. I would give it 5 stars, except that it is difficult to find in the 6 oz size, and it has that room-filling reek that most canned dog foods have (which my dog loves, but I hate). She has not had any digestive issues with the food, and I like that the first three ingredients on the list are all turkey, and the following three are vegetables. I can actually see the sweet potato in the food. My dog doesn't have any food allergies, but I have read that foods using alternative meats such as turkey, lamb and duck can help if your dog has poor reaction to beef based foods. As long as they keep making this, I'll keep buying it.

I love this brand. If you go to their website, sign up for their newsletters. They'll send you $3.00 off coupons every couple of months or so. No so helpful when purchasing through amazon but helpful if you have a local store with Amazon similar pricing like I do ;)

My dog loves this food. I use a spoonful in his dry food every night with some warm water to make it a little soupy for him. I like the ingredients, the way his coat looks, how he NEVER has bad breath or dog farts. Ever.
My dogs and I love this food. They never leave a trace and I am happy that it is healthy for them. I mix it up with the Wellness Super 5 mix.

My geriatric dog has been an extremely fussy eater ever since I brought her home at 14 weeks.  I recently tried Wellness kibble and wet foods and she likes them all, but she particularly LOVES the 95-Percent canned toppers and WOLFS her kibble down with this product mixed in.  Wish I had tried Wellness foods before but better late than never.

This 12-pack case is a great value and is actually about 20 cents cheaper per can than my local pet food store. It arrived very quickly at our house and only one of the cans had a small dent at the base. It still made the swoosh sound when I opened it with the can opener, so the vacuum was still good and the food was still fresh. Great deal, and now I don't have to run out to the pet food store after work every few days to pick up more cans. I can simply drive home to my baby puppy at the end of the day. I did notice that all my dogs have had softer stools with this food, but if I mix it with the dry food and feed less frequently they don't have too much of a problem.
As a newly adopter of a one year old, I tried certain foods with not much success.  My dog loves this food, and I do too, as she eats well and healthy.

My two dogs love Wellness brand dog food.  It's expensive but I just feel I'm doing the right thing for them with food I think is probably good really meaty food. They have begin to turn away from Newmans and I sure don't trust Alpo since the Chinese dogfood scare, but the various Wellness products are the best I can do for my little (and quite big) best friends.
I have been buying this food locally but began to have a hard time fInding it. I searched online and it was a little more cost effective. My pups seem to love this food.
this food is great but I suggest you just buy one can first, too make sure your dog likes it. (because it is expensive, but... your dog is worth it

It seemed like our dogs were getting tired of the same old thing for dinner, so I did some research and found this Wellness brand dog food. What I liked about it was the lack of by-products and cereals. Our dogs love the taste of this food and there is never any left in their bowls. It is a well baqlanced food that good for them also and having it shipped directly to my door saves us a trip to the pet stores. I count on Amazon for the best products.

I just wanted to supplement the dry food that I feed my two schnauzers. I tried several other brands and even other canned food by this same brand. My dogs did not do well on any of them until I tried this one. They love it and it does not cause stomach upset or potty problems. I highly recommend this product for extra protein, esspecialy if your dog has a delicate system.
Since putting our dog on the Wellness dog food, we don't have any more diarrhea or upset tummy issues.
My puppy had a severe diarrhea for weeks until we put her on Wellness Lamb and Sweet Potato.  Just like a miracle, she is healthy and energetic.

If my dog were reviewing this, he'd give it 5 stars - but that's because he's not aware that nutritional imbalances are possible. It's high quality - and he thinks it's delicious.

I looked back at the page after ordering to see if I'd just missed a warning, but I don't think it's there. The page is not clear enough, in my opinion - that this is NOT a balanced diet. I didn't realize until it arrived and has a note on it that says "Wellness 95% Canned Recipes are intended for intermittent or supplemental feeding only."

I get that I should have been aware that something with so few ingredients is obviously not enough for long term feeding, but I do think the page should have a more clear note on it so that when people are ordering a few cases of food quickly it's clear that this one is really more a treat than a meal.

It's good though, for what it aims to be: a canned chicken treat to serve in addition to your dog's normal diet.

I mix this soft food with my Boston Terrier's dry food, so I don't use much for each meal. Using the larger cans meant I would end up throwing half a can away.

Wellness brand is very high quality food, and has been working very well for our dog who has a very sensitive stomach.

I was able to add a full pound to my skinny, 15yr old toy poodle with this.  He loves it and looks forward to dinner again.  I'd order it through Amazon, but it's only one cent cheaper on Amazon than it is in the pet store.
I'll be returning this product.  Half the cans were dented and the lables were falling off.  I tried one can that wasn't dented - my dogs were not impressed.
I have two dogs.  One dog ate all of it, but he even eats durian fruit. The other was very hesitant and didn't finish it. I won't buy this again.

Product was priced fairly; delivery was fast and affordable.  If you have ever had Heinz India Relish, this is exactly like it, which is different than most other pickle relishes--I think it is made with sweet pickles and bread-and-butter pickles.  Mix this relish with fresh or canned corn and a little onion and bell pepper, and you have the perfect Corn Relish for a summer side-dish.  Delicious.

Ok, let's be honest. "Dogs will be dogs" and mine love just about anything edible, but they go absolutely bonkers for these little crisps. I feel good about giving them these as snacks or for training, for a few reasons.

First, just like the box says they're "guilt-free"; made with brown rice and beef, they're wheat & gluten free, low fat and only 12 calories per treat -- so I feel good about not giving them "junk food", per se.

Second, they're light & crispy -- like a puffed rice, so the pups aren't being weighed down by a heavy dog biscuit full of corn & sugar. Lastly, the dogs REALLY like/crave these, so they've been a great tool for training, when I use the crisps as a positive reinforcement for good behavior. When I'm doing repetitive action training over & over again (like teaching my one dog how to shake), I'd rather give him 10 of these than 10 pieces of hot dog or chemical-laden mushy dog snacks. These brown rice & beef Barksters accomplish both of our needs and I'm actually rewarding him with something good for his body and his spirit.

Our dogs love Barksters (all varieties), so when my friend needed to potty train her new rescue dog I recommended them to her.  They worked like a charm!  Since they only have 12 calories and can be broken into smaller bits, she could give a piece every time the dog went out.  It's hard to describe their texture.  They are puffed and crispy, but not fried.  They are crinkly like a potato chip but much thicker.  The best part is that they are all natural...oh, and made in America!

I ordered this company's French Roast and it was awesome. The mesh cups are great, the flavor bold and rich. I should have stuck with the French Roast.  I was sadly dissapointed in Fogchaser. It was actually bland, nothing bold about it.  Either there was something wrong with the coffee or it is just plain weak.  I will reorder the French Roast and give the other 46 cups of Fogchaser to my 87 year old Father-in-law who likes his coffee mild.

I LOVE STRONG COFFEE AND ALMOST ALLWAYS USED "NEWMANS OWN" BUT I DECIDED TO TRY THESE BASED ON THE REVIEWS AND THE GREAT PRICE. WHAT A GREAT MOVE THIS TURNED OUT TO BE INCREDABLE COFFEE ,SMOOTH ,GREAT PRICE ,AND LESS PLASTIC. SO GOOD THAT I STARTED A SUBSCRIPTION,CHANGED TO INCREASE THE QUANTIY,AND NOW HAD TO ORDER A EXTRA SHIPMENT.
Loved the design of these. They fit perfectly in the Keurig brewer. Less plastic and great taste. Have not had any mishaps and no coffee grounds as you can sometimes get with regular Kcups.

I was very pleasantly surprised by how good this coffee is. I have ordered several of their flavors on Subscribe and Save. Can't beat the price and they are all very good tasting coffee.
The pods are different but it is not an issue for me. I don't store them in my carrousel as I am afraid they would get "stale" but instead store them in a ziplock bag in the cabinet. This works great.
I like them all and wish San Fransisco Bay would come out with more flavors.
We were alittle hesitant at first, but love them! Everyone we have offered a cup to are also in love... will continue to purchase as long as the price remains almost unbeatable.

Much less plastic for the environment - way to go.. finally.. just imagine all the plastic cups from everones coffee floating around. I will report back once tasted... the reviews look great. Im game.

This Fog Chaser was available at my local grocery store. I thought I would give it a try. Well let me tell you, even on the highest setting this cup is STRONG. Reminds me of a regular pot of Dark Communittee Coffee. If you think the regular k-cups are just too weak, give this a try and you won't be disappointed.

Coffee preference is just a matter of taste, so my opinion regarding taste probably doesn't mean much. You'd have to try this coffee for yourself. What I can tell you is that these soft bottom cups are certainly different from the usual all-plastic k-cups. I was initially concerned about how well they would work in my Keurig, but after making about fifty or more brews, they work perfectly. No loose grinds left behind in the pod well, my mug or anywhere else. They cost a little less than k-cups so that's a nice plus for me. The minor drawback is that they come to you in plastic bags that once opened, allow exposure of the pods to air. Simple fix. I just put the remaining pods in a ziplock bag.
I like the taste of this French Roast coffee and the fact that it's also cheaper than the competition. Hopefully when the patent on k-cups expires this September we'll see more vendors offering better prices. This is probably why Keurig recently came out with a new brewer, "the VUE" that uses different and patented cups.

I always try my coffee straight black with no cream or sugar the first time. I did not care much for it in that form. Once I put creamer and sugar in though, it is a really good cuppa joe. I probably won't be ordering again since I don't always have cream/sugar available, but I think it is still a solid 4 star since it is so good when properly doctored up.
We love this coffee!  Its delicious and bold, just like we like our coffee.  Its great to be able to get this quality of coffee at such a great price too!
Great coffee for someone who likes a stronger flavor. Small package that really packs a punch - I've had more expensive coffees and really prefer this one!

One of my biggest pet peeves is over-packaging, so I gave the "frustration free" pods a shot. I like that there's less waste to dump in landfills. However, the pods don't work well in my Keurig. In order to brew, I have to push down on the handle until the cycle is done, otherwise, nothing happens. I really like the flavor of the coffee, but keeping it fresh is an issue, even though I store the pods in air-tight containers. I probably won't buy coffee packaged this way in the future.
awesome coffee at an affordable price. delivered to my door at no cost to me.  makes having a keirig brewer even better.
This flavor is my favorite so far. The price isn't bad either.I would recommend this to anybody who is looking for a smooth cup of coffee.

If you are a real coffee drinker you will love this brew.  It is fairly stong but I feel that all coffees should be strong.  The flavor is smooth and there is no bitter aftertase.  Try it and you won't be sorry!  It is now my favorite.

This is an original way to produce a K-Cup, it works very well.  The coffee is good overall, and GREAT for the PRICE.  Signing up for AutoDelivery gets you a price per serving that cannot be touched in the K-Cup universe.  Big whoop, so you have to store the unused balance of the dozen per bag in a ziplock bag ---> for several dollars per box I can handle that!

me: Normally drink Rainforest Espresso

Tried this due to the price and less plastic.

Like it a lot.

Very good and love the concept but wish they shipped in a resealable bag or container.

I bought these "kcups" to save money as the cost on my usual Kcups rose to 51 cents a cup on subscribe and save and I could not find them cheaper anywhere else online or locally. These ecocups produce a nice cup of medium strength coffee (not as strong as a regular Kcup). I use the Fog Chase and French Roast on the 12 ounce setting but the Rainforest is too weak to use so I have to use the 8 ounce setting. The Big plus with these ecocups is that they are really good for use with your own coffee! I use DisposaCup Lids to refill these ecocups over and over again! That's a great vaule at 38 cents a "Kcup"!! DisposaCup Lids - 100 Disposable Replacement Lids for Use with Any Keurig K-cup - BOX of 100 LIDS

This is my new favorite "k-cup" (it's not a k-cup but it fits in all Keurig machines)! It's very strong, but not bitter or burnt--it's just plain great coffee. I wish I had invented this cheaper version of a k-cup, because this design is genius. Out of 15 of my cups of this coffee so far, only one had a coffee ground in it--just one little piece.

This is best with just cream, it's just plain luxurious! Thanks SF Bay Coffee!

I was given a Keurig as a gift and it is so easy to use that I use it almost exclusively. I had previously used several favorite brands/types of coffee and I ground them fresh for use with a drip pot.

Keurig K-cups do not normally meet my expectations, particularly in the strength of the brew but I have adopted the habit of using K-cups for my morning cup to "chase the fog away" and the brands I selected for daily use were good but expensive. This coffee I found as part of a continuous effort to try new brands, to reduce waste but particularly in light of the increase of the price of my favorite brand to ~$0.71/K-cup. Since I drink a double 7oz brew for that first cup to get enough volume with the brew size reduced for strength, that works out to nearly $1.50 a cup IN MY OWN KITCHEN for a less than premium brew. This San Francisco Bay Coffee is of more than acceptable flavor and is very nicely priced @ $0.38/K-cup with an automatic repeating order-- close to half the price of my former choice.

Incidentally, after the morning dose, if I want more, I then have enough functioning brain cells to recycle used, washed K-cups using the K-saver stainless steel lids Re-use K-Cups K-Savers Stainless Steel Lid 5 Pack, for Use with Keurig Machine and my favorite Vietnamese coffee which costs ~$0.20/K-cup. This is the best brew and the least wasteful way but I don't have the patience too do it in the early morning until awake. I recommend it highly.

San Fran Bay coffee are very similar to K-cups but they do not have a complete cup attached to the mesh brew bag. This eliminates a lot of hard plastic waste.

Had to try this as soon as I received it. Made a great bold cup of coffee. Was very impressed  with the "pod". Very little waste, as compared to the regular k-cups. I will be trying different flavors in the future.

I like the idea like most people and saw many good reviews to believe that the coffee will actually taste good.
Nope. The taste is terrible and no aroma. The quality of the coffee bean selection need to be improved.
Disappointed with my first try of san francisco bay kcup coffee.

I purchased this after reading the mostly quite positive reviews which equated its taste with Jet Fuel and other bold flavors.  My first cup (medium setting) was off-putting at best. I brewed my second cup on the small-cup setting, hoping for a bolder and richer flavour and mouth feel; none was forthcoming. I appreciate the less plastic packaging and don't find it a bad flavor - I personally don't find the intense boodness I look forward to in a cup of coffee.

This is very tasty coffee and a bit cheaper than Keurig-sanctioned k-cups. The pod packaging is minimal. I agree there is very little waste. The top looks like a typical k-cup and the bottom looks like a filter. You will want some sort of tupperware or jar to store the onecups once you open the pouch they come in since they will be exposed somewhat to air and lose freshness otherwise. I just use a spare ice cream tub and dump the open bag in there. Perfect!

Today I made myself a larger cup than usual by accident and it was still rich and delicious.

I usually drink the Newman's own coffee that I buy at Costco to give you an idea of my tastes. I think this is better.

I love the convenience of K cups but I don't love the waste so I was looking for an alternative. I've already tried the reusable substitutes but I could never get the right grind of coffee beans to produce the coffee flavor/robustness that I like. This coffee is a great bargain for the price, especially with the Subscribe and Save. It is not my absolute favorite, I still prefer Newman's Own blend, but it is better tasting to me than other K Cup offerings(the Folgers blends for example).  I hope San Francisco Bay comes out with more dark/bold roasts because I would definitely try them.

Nice cup of coffee, I'm not a tree-hugger, but if you are, you will appreciate that it only has a plastic ring/top as opposed to the normal whole plastic k-cup.  I tried it because it is a little cheaper, but still convenient, with the rising cost of coffee (and everything else) compared to grinding yourself and using the ekcobrew (which works much better than the standard k-cup self grind accessory, but is still a bit of a hassle with clean up).  We do vacuum seal a canister with these once we open the plastic bag (the order came with 3 bags of 12 pods), to keep the coffee fresh (since they can't have the oxygen purged like a normal k-cup for freshness).  Overall a nice strong cup that is smooth, with less hassle than self grind and fairly cheap (even cheaper with subscribe and save)
This is great coffee at a great price!  I'm very happy with my purchase and will purchase more in the future.  Yummy.

While some products like the "My K-Cup" don't work in all brewers, the Rogers "One Cup" products are more compatible. They work just fine in the Keurig B-3000, which is a large brewer aimed at the office market. Sometimes you may get the "no K-cup detected" warning, but you can ignore it.

It's great to have an alternative to the Green Mountain products.
The container is better for the environment and the coffee is very good.  I have tried Fog Chaser, French Roast and Rainforest Blend.  All are very good.

I ordered a box based on the reviews and I must say I am somewhat dissapointed. If you enjoy a full flavored medium roast you'll enjoy this one. It has complex flavors and a smooth finish.
That said, it's definitely not full bodied or bold in flavor. My favorite k-cups are Coffee People Organic, Newman's Special Blend Organic, Emril's Big Easy Bold and Timothy's Rainforest Espresso. If you like deep bold coffee flavor this one comes up short.

SF Bay Coffee One Cup is a great option. I felt the coffee was stronger, or less watery, than most k-cups, and the price is a big savings.  It comes with 12 in one sealed bag, so I rolled the bag up tightly between uses and used them up within a few days. Not a good choice if you want lots of variety.

While the container that goes into the brewer looks odd it seems to work well.  The coffee arrived in a box with three individual bags of 12 "pods".  I used the first two of these this morning and did not have any problems with the brewing.  They seemed to work just fine.  I liked the strong robust flavor of the coffee.
I am pleased with this brand of coffee, great flavor and no waste with the great design. Will be one of my favorite blends now.

This coffee tastes like a good cup of gas station or fast food coffee (i.e., objectively average, at best). It is not very flavorful, particularly compared to other k-cup brands on the market. But, this coffee is also 30-50% less expensive per cup.

It's also worth noting (as other reviewers have) that these need to be kept in an air-tight container because they are not individually sealed; the bottoms of each cup are semipermeable filters--not air tight plastic like other k-kups. This is inconvenient if you prefer to keep your k-cups in a k-cup tower next to the machine.

The only reason I won't give the San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser a 5 star, is that once you open the sealed bag the coffee doesn't stay fresh for very long. I enjoyed the coffee, had great aroma and love that it's packaging is reduced plastic compared to original Kcups. The main thing I loved was the price!
