I would stick the real K Cups and skip this.Remember amazon does not offer refunds on this either since its a grocery item.

I believe this coffee tastes as good as any brand of K-Cup I've ever tried while currently costing about a third less (using subscribe and save on Amazon).  It actually tastes fresher to me than other K-Cups, possibly because it arrives packed in a plastic bag which seems airtight until opened.

I was a little worried about this k-cup since it is shaped differently from the regular k-cups. Instead of being in a fully plastic container, only the top is plastic. The bottom part is enclosed in a coffee filter type holding. While this means that when I opened the sealed wrapper I was hit with the delicious aroma of coffee, something I miss when I open a regular pack of k-cups, it also means I have to store the remaining cups in a tupperware or storage ziploc type bag to keep the remaining cups from going stale. This isn't a big deal, just something to mention. These also wouldn't fit in the normal k-cup carousel.

I have a b60 and the cup fit perfectly, brewed up great, disposal was easy and the filter didn't tear or leak as I was throwing it way.

Fog chaser is a bold deep brew (I brew on the middle button of my keurig) The coffee is very smooth and mellow with a terrific aroma. There is no bitter or burned taste. This is quickly becoming my favorite keurig coffee and I can't wait to try the other offerings from this company.

I've urged Amazon to change this product's listing so as not to trick anyone else into buying it, but until they do, I want to add my voice to the revelations hidden in a few reviews that are already here. Please be warned that while the first cup of this coffee is tasty, the second is unlikely to be as good, and the twelfth is almost guaranteed to be disappointing unless you're the twelve-cup-a-day sort of household.

Why? Simply put, these are not K-Cups. They are not individually sealed portions, but instead are open mesh coffee pods, not dissimilar to Senseo pods, topped with a K-Cup-like plastic ring and foil cover. That cover does make them work in Keurig brewers, but you lose the important freshness-preserving feature of K-Cups. The company could lessen this problem by putting its pods in a resealable plastic bag, but they chose to instead use a plastic bag reminiscent of those in cereal boxes -- just much, much harder to open. That's especially ironic given Amazon's recent move toward frustration-free packaging.

I strongly encourage you to move on to another product until the San Francisco Bay Coffee folks can temper their (laudable) green-focused pod design with some reasonable solution for keeping the coffee fresh for more than a day or so once you open the box.

This is my second favorite flavor from SFBC.  Breakfast blend is still the best.  All flavors have plenty of flavor for a 16oz travel mug. (If you don't have the larger cup size on your machine, brew at the small cup setting and lift the handle and brew again) Can't beat the value especially if you get them via Amazon subscription.  Hey Amazon when are you going to sell these in the 80 pack?

We've ordered the Fog Chaser OneCup twice now. The first time we ordered it, I LOVED it. We are avid coffee drinkers in my house, and both love a nice bold coffee. Since the price was right and we liked the coffee, we ordered again. The 2nd shipment we received was still "good" coffee, but it wasn't as great as the first. My husband says he couldn't tell much difference, but the 2nd shipment did not have the same smooth finish and mouth-watering aroma as the original. That being said, it did not stop us from drinking it all, but I do have to wonder which is the abnormality! I rated this at a 4 since we were so impressed by the first shipment, and I really like the way the OneCup brews. As other reviewers mentioned, there is a "crema" produced by the OneCup that you rarely see with a K-Cup, which is NICE! I like the less packaging, and don't mind the occasional sediment in my cup (when we brew coffee, we generally do French Press, so we can handle that!). If I had the option of rating 3.5 I would have, since the quality of the 2nd shipment would definitely rank a 3 most likely. I do think we will try this again and see if "the third time is the charm". I will try to remember to update on what we think so that we can provide some feedback as far as consistency goes.
Thanks for reading!

Bold and rich. LOVE this coffee for a fast wake-me-up in the morning, and pick-me-up mid day. The name is perfectly suited to the delightful temperament of this brew. MUST store in airtight container after opening the plastic bags though, or coffee will lose it's potency.

Recently I have become more and more choosy with my coffee. I own a Keurig one-cup brewer as well as a traditional coffee maker.
For years, I have been using the same coffee brand ( med or dark, middle-of-the road priced) and it was affordable and it tasted just fine. Lately, I was lacking depth and body when brewing in the keurig( I have the cup you can put your own coffee in, which saves resources and $). It seemed like I couldnt' pack enough flavor into the little chamber to really have the right strength. The pre-packed, ready to use K cups were much better, but at 3 cups/day for me not feasible in the long run.
I read the reviews of the San Francisco Bay coffee ( fog chaser) and the price appealed to me and also what customers had described, so I tried it. Besides the much more affordable price and far more "green" packaging, I find the flavor fantastic!
Bold, yet sophisticated, not just strong- really pleasant flavor ! A very good choice at an attractive price!. These cups look different, but I like them much better with their filter-like body and 12-count bagging. Now I don't feel guilty when I indulge with more than 1 K cup. For loose coffee to put into the reusable cup I choose a def. dark roast like italian or french, which is very comparable to the Fog chaser's aroma.

SFBC's Fog Chaser is on the bold side... dark, rich, but not too much aftertaste. A great daily coffee. Be aware that the entire cup is not plastic, but the bottom portion is almost filter material. This might affect how long you keep the cups before using. The cups are vacuum sealed into a larger plastic bag, so that should help with freshness...

The cost is on the low end for k-cups and makes this coffee even more inviting!!! I definitely recommend as a staple daily coffee.

All the best,

Jay

The Keurig cups always had something missing. They reminded me of coffee but always tasted a little funny. I really do think it's all the plastic surrounding the coffee. I didn't get much use out of my Keurig until I found this coffee. I am reordering today!

Fantastic Coffee, at a a fraction of the price of the freeze dried Keurig K-cup's, all of which are made by the same company, with the same tasteless coffee bean, no matter what the name of the coffee.  I can't imagine paying a dollar a cup for a "donut house" k-cup that is made of Folgers.  What a joke.
I love this coffee. I started buying it in the grocery store, but this is a lot cheaper at Amazon. Rich, flavorful, and smells just like I ground the beans myself. Going to re-order right now.

When I got my Keurig, I couldn't wait to get my favorite Starbucks coffee in K Cups. When I saw this, I liked the design of the cup and the price is much better too. I'm so glad I decided to give it a try. Doing a side by side comparison, Fog Chaser wins hands down! If you like a bold cup that lingers on your tongue and hold up under creamer too (I use unsweetened coconut milk), you will be happy you tried this coffee. Oh! A huge added bonus of the new environmentally friendly K Cup design is that you get that heavenly coffee aroma from the minute you open the vacuum sealed bag! You don't have to wait until its brewing to "wake up and smell the coffee!" :)

Personally, I received this product by going down the list of K-Cups trying to find that perfect cup to put on scheduled delivery.  This is a nice bold coffee, and oddly fiscal.  I personally like the first brew, and the house mate likes the second and third, now THAT is a good deal.
Bought this product however it doesnt seem like a great way to keep the coffee airtight. I tried the other K-cup similar cups and they seem to keep it fresher.
This is a robust roast. Definitely a morning coffee.  We love the flavor and the value! Be sure to store in an airtight container to maintain the flavor.
I have tried 5 or 6 different brands and found this brand to be the better one. I am sticking with this for now.

First time trying SF coffee and found it to be a good coffee with a reasonable taste. Yes, the coffee smells burned prior to use but I believe thatunless you are a  connoisseur of coffee I believe most might smelled "burnt".  Good coffee for the price and the "K-Cup" new packaging works just as well as the original stle K-Cup packaging. I believe I will try another brand for taste but would stay with SFbay if the price were 5 cents less per cup.  I drink alot of coffee.!!

Not the coffee for us. Very strong. Did the subscribe and save, for got to cancel the next shipment, went to and complete the return forms- No such luck. Great idea, just tastes awful. First item that I could not return, back to buy coffee at QVC, they will take it back if we do not like it.
This coffee was really good Fogchaser will get you going. It's a strong bold cup of coffee.  This cofee is valued price with a great taste!

Decided to give these a try based on price.  The coffee tastes great but since the 'cups' don't have the plastic bottoms (a filter element), we had to store in a sealed jar to keep them fresh and not have the coffee bean smell thru-out the house.  (or you could use a plastic ziploc - original bag was not re-sealable).  They did one thing finally right - you don't have to pay MORE for going green when buying LESS packaging.  Kudos.

i dont no what the big fuss is about a lot of bad reviews but if u read the description you shoulld no it comes revealed and not in plastic like regualr kcups anyhow i ordered the fogchaser and they were great i amade iced coffee with mine and the flavor was perfect i just keep it in some tupperware to keep fresh is all i plan on buying all 3 flavors and encourage they should come out with even more flavors the price is awsome beats paying 15 bucks for 18 kucps when i just paid 14 for 36 kcups i will def keep on buying these

25 lbs. of hard licorice pieces were dumped into kitchen trash bags, unsealed, then put into a cardboard box. The most disgusting, unsanitary packaging I've ever seen. I tossed the entire thing in the trash.
To top it off, the first ingredient in the whole thing was corn syrup. Yuk.
Avoid like the plague.

Our nine-month-old daughter is ready for a more substantial breakfast than plain cereals.  We want her to get the nutrients and vitamins she needs (especially iron), so plain fruit or vegetables aren't enough.  This blend of fruit and grains (and, in some cases, yogurt) provides everything she needs for a good breakfast and keeps her full for several hours.  Plus, the flavors are not overly sweet.  One note:  at least two of these flavors include yogurt.  Some babies younger than 1-year may have a reaction to yogurt and other dairy foods, so just watch out for that.
My son loves all the food by earths best but would like to mention that it's way cheaper buying in store than amazon. Amazon charges 2 - 3$ more than stores.

We feed our baby this Wholesome Breakfast at any time of the day, not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  We particularly like that this food contains yogurt.  When she was young (~6 months old), our baby loved yogurt but couldn't eat it plain because it would cause a rash around her mouth.  She was never bothered by the yogurt in this food, though, perhaps because it was mixed with other things.  Now that she's older (10 months), our baby can eat all the yogurt she wants without a skin reaction, but for awhile, this variety of Wholesome Breakfast was the only source of her favorite food.

My daughter loves the entire Earths Best line.  I taste everything before I feed it to her and each item tastes pure and fresh.  Very happy.  We've tasted other popular name brands, and Earths Best is really good in comparison.
I tried all kinds of oatmeal to give my LO but this is her favorite one. I also love the fact that it comes on time.

If I had only figured out to order baby food online before.  The price is right on the money and the convenience of the shipping to the house is great.  No need to go to the store and have baby jars flying all over the cart.  This flavor is my baby's favorite.  It's a go to when she is not in the mood for anything else.

I love Earth's Best products and only use them to feed my baby, besides home made foods. I rate this one one star because the seller didn't specify that this product contains milk, which my baby cannot tolerate since he is lactose-intolerant. So for us, it was a waste of money, and I bought two packs...

This baby food, labeled for 6+ months, contains heavy cream. My baby could not digest it; we had a very bad day. Maybe I missed that in the description, but in any case, everywhere I've read and according to my pediatrician, you're supposed to avoid cow's milk products before age 1 (why they make formula using cow's milk and not a much more digestible milk like goat baffles me and is a rant for another time--my son drinks the lactose free kind, in any case). I ordered another variety of "Wholesome breakfast" too: Pear, Apple, Oatmeal. Same thing there. I'm guessing they all have heavy cream in them.
My daughter likes it now, but when she was younger she did not want to have it! Go figure! Now she is almost 14 months she digs the flavor.
My son hated it. I tasted some and saw why. It's tart and the barley gives it a weird smell and flavor. Yuck!

I wish Amazon would include a list of ingredients on baby food in bulk. This has cream in it and my baby has a cow's milk intolerance. I had already opened the jar when I read the ingredients and now I'm stuck with 15 jars of food I can't use. So disappointing.
Price was great, variety, flavor was good, baby likes it! She takes a while to eat, but it's safe and clean to leave in the refrigerator.
Great baby foods!  I like the variety pack.  Much cheaper than buying it from the local grocers or co-op!  I Just wish they came in the squeezie pouches!
I love how it's thicker than other Stage 2 baby food. My son gobbles it down! Way better than the lunch or dinner varities!

This is one of my sons favorites. Even though it's called "wholesome breakfast" he usually has this for lunch. It is packed with nutrients, including 35% of his daily iron. This is a staple in our baby's diet!

We feed our baby this Wholesome Breakfast at any time of the day, not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  Also, our baby is a picky eater, so we're thrilled to find something she likes that's more substantial than Puffs!
I enjoy most of the Yogi teas but this particular one tastes almost sinful. I don't know that it necessarily tastes a lot like vanilla or hazelnut but it has a very delicious spicy taste.

I bought 4 high end dry foods that my miniature poodle simply would not eat. I tried mixing it with canned food and broth, but she'd lick off the canned food and leave the kibble. I was worried that she wasn't getting the nutrients she needed. Then I found Utramix and I am thrilled. She loves it, actually cleans her bowl. I merely drizzle a little warm water on it since I'm no longer mixing in canned food and she gobbles it up. There are chunks of bananas, peas, carrots, etc. that she seems to love. The mix even contains probiotics. Highly recommended.

A extremly healthy plant that has grown dramatically since its arrival. It should be an exceptional plant for blooming if it casts blooms as readily as it grows vegatatively. I have high expectations for this one!

About 10 years ago while visiting disneyworld in orlando florida my wife and I met a nice english couple. Being a tea drinker I inquired about good english teas and they gave me a napkin with the names of bewleys tea on it and about 6 teabags for me to try. I put the napkin in my back pocket and the teabags got wrapped up in an old sandwich bag and put in my wife's purse. We parted with the nice english couple and as we traveled around disneyworld it began to rain that afternoon and we got soaking wet. I found what was left of the napkin that evening at the hotel and it was unreadable. About 6 months later at home the bag fell out of my tea closet as i was fixing to make a cup and I decided to finally try the tea those nice folks from england raved about. I loved the tea and I believe I have finally found it in bewleys. Some of the best tea I have had. The english surely know their tea.

I have been drinking Taylors of Harrogate, Yorkshire Gold Tea until I tried Bewley's. I have always like my tea very strong using double the amount of most people. I drink it with cream and sugar and this tea is perfect for me. I do not have to put in extra because it is full bodied and stands up to cream and sugar wonderfully. I have been drinking it in the morning and have been using the Yorkshire Gold for the afternoon. Bewley's is my favorite now, not that Yorkshire Gold sucks or anything but I like it strong. I will still search for another tea perhaps as good. Life is an adventure and you never know when you're going to bingo.

If you like a strong, not bitter brew try Bewley's! After you've had Irish it is hard to go back, teawise that is.

Recently purchased these treats for my 4 dogs from local grocery store. After giving my dogs these chews, my 3 month old puppy threw up the treat. By the next day at lunch time, he was exhibiting neurotoxic symptoms. We immediately took him to the vet for blood work, which all came back below normal limits. He was given IV therapy and monitored over night. Over the next two days, my older dogs (ages 4, 7 and 9)began vomiting and acting lethargic, but with no neurological symptoms. We traced the cause back to these chews, as it is the only coomon thing among all the dogs (puppy eats different food than adult dogs, puppy is walked on a leash not allowed to run around in yard yet, puppy is not out of his crate unless he is beig observed, etc.). After speaking with someone at a pet store, we learned some rawhide chews are pressed with water, while others are pressed with formaldehyde. While it is not listed which method these use, we are concerned it is the formaldehyde. In the case of the older dogs, their GIs are rejecting them due to the toxins. With the puppy, his immature renal and hepatic system exhibited neurotoxicity.

I ordered these tails a while back for my Parents to be shipped to St. George, Utah. The customer service and express shipping were excellent. The tails were recieved on time and still frozen. The best part is the tails are very large and sometimes from other sources, I have recieved tails this size that were "Soft" and not firm meat. These were fantastic and were saved up to 3-4 months with a couple retrived from the freezer and broiled....perfectly every time..Thank
s for the great product and service!!

I confirm another review here that perfectly describes the texture and taste of this product as like chewing on a cellulose sponge! OMG! I love tofu, by the way. This is the first tofu I've eaten in decades that I did not like.

I bought this after reading that review and thinking the person was maybe not familiar with the taste of tofu, or perhaps tried to eat this without re-hydrating this first. No, it is like chewing on a sponge (Have we all by accident done this, or is it an early childhood memory of times when we tested everything with our mouths?) At any rate, you will instantly think "sponge" if you ignore these warnings and buy this tofu. I do not mean just the texture, it really tastes like a cellulose sponge!

I am also a fan of Eden Foods and enjoy many of their products, they make great tamari, for instance. I was looking for that texture and taste I find in freeze dried tofu pieces that come in soup mixes as in instant miso tofu soup packets or soup cups. This isn't that tofu! It will not be wasted, it has good protein and I can chop it in very small pieces and mix it with Creamy Tomato Soup by Pacific Naturals, that makes it innocuous enough. But I'll never buy this again!

I am looking into buying a food dehydrator to make my own. The cost of tofu is much lower that this item reflects. I will update this if I have success drying my own tofu. Believe the reviews here, this isn't good.

If you feel compelled to buy this, get it from Whole Foods so you don't waste money buying the 6 pack. Buyer beware that you cannot return many food items. The texture of this after rehydration was like a cellulose sponge.If you must have dehydrated tofu for hiking or camping trips, make your own or buy the tofu in the sealed boxes.  On the flip side, I love many of Eden products but this was a waste of my money.

Koya Dofu, or freeze-dried tofu, requires a specific approach to cooking. It not only has to be rehydrated in a particular way, but also will not taste good without proper cooking to flavor and soften it. Even at that point, it will have a chewy, slightly spongey texture, but if cut and cooked appropriately, it is not a strange texture and is very delicious as a side dish.

Google recipes for Koyadofu and try one that involves simmering it (after rehydration) in a broth made of katsuobushi (if you are not vegetarian -- if you are, then use mushroom or vegie stock), shouyu or tamari, mirin, and a little sweetner. My child loves this, and I pack it in her school lunch box along with rice, and some vegies that have been simmered in the same broth.

We'd been buying the four-pack of Melitta French Vanilla coffee once a month for the past 2 years. We won't be any more. In the last month they changed their packaging, which is fine, but also changed the grind. All of a sudden, these four packs come in "extra fine grind," which simply doesn't work well at all in our drip coffee maker. The whole pot tastes weak until you get to the last couple of cups, which taste more like mud because all of the coffee has settled. Here's hoping they switch back at some point, because this is just bad.

I have been a big Starbucks fan for a long time now, but thought I would try something that I could do the subscribe and save deal on. I chose this one because of the great reviews and thought it would make a change to have a flavored coffee. I am so glad I did! I love it. It is so smooth and the aroma when you open the can is wonderful. Can't wait to try the other types of Melitta coffee now too.

I am a fan of Melitta's other coffees, especially hazelnut, but they just didn't get French Vanilla right. There is something of a chemical aftertaste to it that contradicts the nice aroma. It's noticeable enough to make you wonder if something is "not quite right" with it. Not disgusting, you can definitely get through your cup but not delicious either.

I was a little apprehensive about ordering coffee online.  I had never heard of this brand, but to my delight, it is absolutely delicious.  I love it and my husband enjoys the Vanilla and also one of the other blends.  I would recommend if you are fan of any flavored coffee.

I thought these were going to be the same size as the ones in the grocery store. I found they were smaller and more expensive to buy online then if I just bought the bigger ones for 99 cents each at the grocery store.

$23.52 for ten pounds of these beans???  I just bought a bag of these at Sam's Club for $8.95.  If you want to pay nearly 4 times the going rate, by ALL MEANS, purchase this!  Seriously, how STUPID would a person need to be to pay $2.53 for a pound of dried beans?

I like variety in my gf cereals and this granola is a nice addition to my shelf. The granola comes in packets inside the box so it is handy for travel. It's sweet but not too sweet. I eat it in a bowl with milk and it is just the right amount. Granola is more dense so a portion is smaller than a bowl full of cereal.

I've been eating Glutenfreeda's Granola for breakfast the past two months and I love it!
especially the individual packaging, keeps it fresh.

Glutenfreeda's gluten free granola is an ideal breakfast food for people who have to eat gluten free.  It also makes an on the road snack that is easy to pack in your purse or carry on luggage.  The oats in it are guarrenteed to be gluten free.
Although this coffee tastes fine there is nowhere enough coffee in the pod.  The cup that is brewed even with a smaller amount of water is weak and watery.
The Parisian Cafe blend is wonderful but it is too thick to fit correctly in the Senseo machine.  The box advertises universal fit but it is not.

Coffee has a great flavor and is not too acidic. Fits perfectly in out "Juan Valdez" pod maker that was purchased at Target several years ago! So hard to find these so was glad to find them on Amazon!
Smooth coffee, but a bit to big for senseo, interestingly all the other Melitta One pod flavors fit just fine in senseo, my fav are french kisses and vanilla haze.
My husband didn't care for this coffee at all.  He complained it lacked flavor and aroma.

Some issues with the product -- some of the pods are not sealed properly so the grounds spill out (either before use or after use into your coffee); it is wasteful that each pod is individually sealed -- would rather they be packaged like the Senseo pods; the pods don't really fit my Senseo coffee maker -- too fat for the single and too small for the double which causes problems sometimes when I brew a cup.  On the plus side -- price.

Melitta pods are full flavored; however, they do not fit my senseo coffee machine.  One pod in a two pod holder is too small and two pods are too large.  Sure do wish senseo was still readily available in the super markets!

My mom has the Hamilton Beach single cup coffee maker and was using Senseo pods in it. They were too strong / bitter for her and I was searching for something else.  Found these and Wolfgang Puck's and decided to get both for her.  These Melitta Breakfast Blend pods are her favorite! She says they have a smooth taste and great flavor. Granted, neither of us would ever be mistaken for a coffee judge by anyone (I don't even drink coffee so my opinion means nothing), but she really likes these and is happy to have them.

To make a decent cup of coffee I have to use two pods at a time. I prefer a strong cup of coffee even if it IS decaf.
What happened to Senseo decaf?

This coffee .Melitta One:One Java Pods,Breakfast Blend Coffee, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4) is terrible. Cheap beans, bad roast, whatever, my lot actually tastes like it is moldy. Maybe I just got a bad batch. I have tried the Buzzworthy dark roast Melitta Pods and they are drinkable, even though I prefer medium roast coffees. Suggest you try one box of these, not the 4 box lot I'm stuck with. Also, to help you evaluate this response better, you should know that I like quality roast Kenya AA or Sumatra or Columbian Supremo, etc. rich flavor type coffees. I don't like Folgers, Maxwell House, pedestrian type blends, but even those are way better than this coffee.

Melitta Pods are an inexpensive alternative to k-cups  that also save in the amount of material you have to throw away. Buyer Beware: Pods vary GREATLY in the amount of coffee they have in them. These allow for a good size cup of coffee.

I have a Melitta One:One machine and have been using Juan Valdez pods in it.  When I ran out I searched for pods for it & only came up with these Melitta-brand ones. I figured (incorrectly) that the others weren't available & purchased these. VERY disappointing.  My coffee had been nice, strong & tasty, but coffee made with these is weak & tasteless.  I bought a 4-box package of three different types & am now stuck with them. Forget these & head to Juan Valdez (same price range) unless you like weak coffee.
A decent, clean, and simple cup of morning decaf. I find pre-wetting the pod helps extract a little extra flavor.
just the greatest thing when you have your favorite coffee at such a fair price deliverd right to your door :) I will be doing this again. Thank you !

I only buy Fromm for my dog. He loves it and I feel good about feeding it to him.  No fillers, the first ingredient is meat/fish.  This seller had a more than fair price and shipping was faster than I expected.  I would definitely buy from them again!
This product is great!  I can't seem to find it locally at my pet food stores and it's worth feeding my pet the best!!  Super fast delivery from this seller!
The hazelnut flavor is unique.  I'm glad Amazon has decided to carry them, because they are hard to find locally.
Hands down this is absolutely the best kona coffee I have ever had in my life..This is the smoothest and richest coffee you will ever have...Go ahead and spoil yourself, you'll be glad you did!!

I can see why plenty of people will think this is the best coffee ever. It's some of the smoothest, least bitter coffee I've ever tasted. The aroma is also delicious. Opening the bag and taking a whiff right away is a must if you want to try this.

But I'm the type of coffee drinker who loves it black, so I need a coffee with a rich flavour on its own. I don't wanter bitterness, but I love coffee with kick to it.

I'd call it too mild but that's kind of oversimplifying it. It's worth a try to make up your own mind though.

Aloha Island Coffee Company Bonzai Pipeline Dark Roast is a very mediocre, insipid coffee, rather acidic for a dark roast. The beans are of unknown origin, but if there are any Kona beans in this anonymous mix, they must be the ones other roasters threw out as it doesn't even vaguely taste like Kona. Actually, Aloha Island Coffee Co. isn't even in Hawaii, it's located in Santa Ana, CA, an area not exactly known for great coffee. The coffee is extremely overpriced for the poor quality you get, which is why I gave it one star, and you would be better off buying some of the better brands commonly sold in supermarkets at about one-third the price. I ordered the 2-8 oz bags, but I couldn't even make it through the first one and have thrown the second in the garbage. I would never buy anything from Aloha Island Coffee company again.

I'm more of a tea drinker but occasionally want something different and I like this to keep me up or wake me up too. So, keep in mind I haven't tasted lots of coffees. I find most coffees bitter and gross, like starbucks or whatever my mom buys. With some splenda I actually enjoy this, so even if you don't like coffee give this a try. It's definitely one of the better one.

This coffee is the absolute best.  I found it by accident a couple of months ago and now I can not have any other kind of coffee.  It may be more expensive than some, but well worth it.  Plus, you aren't going to want to go out to Starbucks anymore!  Manufacturer ships quickly too!

Pretty good coffee I really liked it
It is a bit on the strong side or it may be the way I brewed it but it is a good tasting coffee in my opinion.

Product looked and smelled great - however, it was not clear from the description that this product is for non-ESE pod machines. I like the idea of organic and US source, this just didn't work for me.
This was purchased for my daughter and her husband.  I was very pleased with the selection of items in the basket.

These crackers make a handy quick snack on the go or at my desk.  I do wish that the mix was four of the cheese filled crackers and four peanut butter rather than two cheese and six peanut butter, which is why I only gave it four stars.  But I like the taste and convenience so much that I have this on auto-ship monthly.  And I like having some variety, which is why I order the variety pack instead of all the same flavor.
love these little crackers and a great price on these will be ordering from this vendor again expiration on these was bout 6 months away

Fast delivery by Amazon.

I've always liked Keebler products and think these are good. I use them for a quick easy feed. My dog also likes them and recommends them to other dogs.

Just had this for the first time at PF Chang's in Sacramento yesterday.  I was utterly amazed at how good it is and I am a tough critic, having been a long-time Earl Grey lover.  It's great with food because the taste is light and refreshing; it's also delicious, by the way.  It's perfect for summertime, perfect frosty cold with lots of ice.  And it's real tea, not a powder.  It smells so good I almost want to wear it! Can you tell?  I LOVE this tea!
We eat at PF Changs fairly often and love the jasmine blackberry tea they serve. Looked all over for something like it, found China Mist and are delighted that it is the exact, same tea!

We drink a lot of tea in our house.  It is the drink of choice for lunch and dinner with both myself and my husband and our oldest son.  This blackberry jasmine tea is wonderful.  It tastes very much like the Jasmine blackberry tea we get at PF Chang's restaurant.  I don't know if it is the same but it tastes very simliar.  I add just a touch of sugar which seems to bring out the flavors so much.  If you are a tea drinker who appreciates flavors other than the typical, this is a wonderful product.  Also, the service was fast and accurate.  We will definitely be purchasing this again when we run out.

I gave up diet coke last year. I drink water but it gets old after a while. I don't like sweet tea, but I do like to have a little flavor. This is has such a wonderful, light flavor. Even my kids like this tea! I've been stocking up so that I have plenty at all times!

A friend of mine got me started drinking unsweetened green tea at Starbucks, and I fell in love with it. It was delicious. Because I enjoyed it so much, I ordered green tea when some coworkers took me to lunch at Kona in Baltimore Inner Harbor. It was SO good, it blew the Starbucks stuff out of the water. We eat at Kona a lot, and I always drink so much of the tea that I feel like I'm sloshing when I leave. It's so rare that I find a drink that I enjoy sipping ... not just guzzling it down because I'm thirsty.

Today, I finally asked the server which brand they serve, though I didn't have hopes of finding it in consumer size containers (I assumed they'd be buying from direct-to-restaurant suppliers). I am SO thrilled to find that it's accessible. And cheaply at that! I'm about to order several of these to keep myself pleasantly stocked in the house. this stuff is delightful.
I have only tried the Strawberry and it was suprisingly good. Some after-taste as would be expected but really good otherwise. I use this to supplement my workouts.

After being on a low-carb diet for the past few months, I was desperate for something sweet.  These almonds were like HEAVEN!  They were just what the doctor ordered and just a handful satisfied my craving for sweets.  I now eat a few after dinner every night and don't feel like I'm missing anything.  They are sweetened with Sucralose so they fit into the low-carb diet.  I liked them so well that I'm going to try the chocolate ones.  I'm also going to crush some up and put it in my "lite" vanilla yogurt for a granola like breakfast.  I highly recommend them!
26 dollars to ship 2 loaves of bread?  I can go to the grocery store and get like 12 loaves for this price.

I purchased this sauce at a local grocery store this afternoon. I opened it and gave it a quick taste. Absolutely no flavor to be realized . I don't know why a company would put out such a bland product when spices to repair the taste are readily available. This is a bad product. Buy something else.

I'd label this as flavored water, but bottled water has more flavor. I noticed when I poured it into a sauce pan for heating it up, almost half, maybe more, was just water. Upon actually eating it, I couldn't help but notice what little bit of flavor there was tasted like regular olive oil (as opposed to the "Extra Virgin olive oil listed in the ingredients). I'd like to think it was a bad batch, but even then you'd think quality control was better than that. Either way, I'd recommend buying a single container locally and trying that before buying a bulk quantity.

I wasn't sure how many nuts were going to be in this package. I just wanted a few, but there are over a dozen nuts in this package. I have given many away to friends and family. There is a brief description about the use of the outer layer for mace and the inner kernel for the nutmeg. If you don't have a need for so much nutmeg, it makes a great gift for the other cooks in your cirle of friends.

I was very pleased with the quality of this this product plus the cost. I could not have done so well in the super markets.
Thank you Amazon.

SERIOUSLY PEOPLE ???

$7.00 S&H on a $3.00 product ?????

250% of the product price for SHIPPING ????

I have had heavy text books delivered for WAY less

The Capri Sun Lemonade drink puches are very handy and good tasting. My kids really like the flavor and we like that it is controlled amount of drink.

The pouch comes with a straw that has a pointy end to puncture the pouch. It is easy to make it "spout" if you squeeze the pouch, so little kids might need adult help.

Very convenient and highly recommended!

I picked up a bottle of this unique soda at JIM'S APPLE FARM - an awesome seasonal store located in southern MN. Seeing as today is "Talk Like a Pirate Day," and the bottle's artwork has a nice skull and crossbones motif, it only seemed fitting to share this crazy beverage with co-workers. I pried open the bottle and took a sniff, wherein I noticed a slightly herbal scent; considering the long list of herbal ingredients on the label, this wasn't particularly suprising. I then poured the nearly blood red elixir into a cup and took an initial swallow. I was rather suprised by the initial bitterness of the soda; it definitely wasn't what I was expecting! Continuing with a couple more swallows, I then started to notice a slight burning sensation in my esophagus -- this, no doubt, came from the jalapeño oil that was infused into the beverage. I wasn't sure if I liked this soda at first. However, the more that I drank it, the more that I came to enjoy this bizarre concoction. It also seemed to cure my morning craving for caffeine, so that was pretty cool too. My co-workers weren't so thrilled with this beverage, but I thought that it was pretty good. At the very least, it makes for good discussion as a novelty item.

Brain Wash (as well as all the other Skeleteen drinks) are mind-bogglingly nostalgic from the first sip! From what I can tell, this company is no longer in production. I highly recommend trying this amazing soda before it's too late!

sounded interesting with some okay ingredients,but... package arrived with four out of twelve bottles broken...also, the taste is just a little too unique. I still have bottles left and I can't even give them away. And the blue color is so intense your tongue will stay blue for days.(and so will your BM's)

I can not find these Cella Milk Chocolate Covered Cherries in local retail stores.  So I ordered these online.  I was surprised to receive them so quickly.  I had them 2 days after I ordered and I ordered on a Sunday.  However, once I opened them and ate a few I am disappointed.  The liquid center in these candies is gone and the cherries inside are all dried up.  Somehow the liquid filling either evaporated are just dried up as there is no sticky evidence of leaking in the box.  Also, the milk chocolate has a chalky look as if it has oxidized.  We can still eat them as they are okay, but they are not as advertized on the outside of the box as containing a clear liquid center.  I think it's obvious that these Chocolates are just very old and probably have exceeded their optimum shelf life.  I will not order from this reseller again.

The first thing I noticed was an odd smell. That dissipated after a half hour or so. Off to a bad start. But I was willing to try one. It was sticky. The wrappers clearly had a layer of the cream filling all over the outsides.
In fact half of them were sticky. There was the source of the smell. There is no indication any of them were damaged and leaked that might have caused the stickiness. There are three levels separated by a sheet of cardboard but no stickiness on the cardboard. Because of all that they were sticky before they were put into the box.
Never again.
Especially now that they included the warning about pits on the box. A. You know they are using real cherries and B. You could bite into a pit so chew carefully.
Suffice it to say that no other chocolate covered cherries are as good as Cella's.  These have been my favorite for many, many years.
If you like Huckleberries, this one is for you, just grab a spoon (like we did) and skip the toast.  Our only complaint, not enough . . . we placed another order 2 days later.

This past season was my first sugaring experience.  I was happy with this filter, it took out a lot of sediment and crystals for a pretty nice syrup. I would wet the filter with warm water before running the warm syrup through it and it worked effectively. This is tall and skinny and I didn't have anything to really hold it up, so actually filtering took a bit of coordination.  I somewhat wish I had a shorter fatter filter, but haven't seen any out there. I cleaned it quickly each time I used it, but by the end of the season with the darker syrup it did get some staining. I will consider getting the filter liners for next season and maybe something that will hold it in place for me (if that exists).
This filter did a great job on my small backyard operation.  After running my syrup through it I didn't have any sentimentation.
I LOVE BANANA TAFFY! and it's hard to find. I recieved my taffy petty fast and it did my craving! No I'm not pregnant. Just LOVE!!! I would work with this buyer again! Excellent to do business with!

Chocolates and caramels
And toffee supreme-y
Twelve different types
So deliciously creamy

Caramel cups
And slim toffee fingers
Milk chocolate blocks
For a sweetness that lingers

Orange that's creamy
Plus orange that crunches
Chocolate noisettes
That taste great after lunches

Strawberry and Coconut
Hazelnuts too
Chocolate fudge
Plus two toffees to chew

Give this for a gift
That you'll never regret
The person receiving
Will never forget

I bought two this Christmas
And wrapped them with glee
Then gave them to someone
Deserving them - ME!

Conclusion:

Candy is dandy
When you have it handy
But for a real treat
Try Quality Street

Amanda Richards, January 3, 2009

I first became exposed to these when my husband's aunt sent some to the family from England.  His parents had grown up on them, but we don't get these in the U.S. even though Nestle now owns the brand.  If you like toffee candies, you have to get this!!  I am seriously addicted to half of the candies in this assortment and ordered one tub for his family for Christmas and other for just the two of us!

Quality Street chocolates are a Xmas tradition in many families. I must have them during the holidays or it is not the same. They have become very difficult to find in the US over the last few years but thank god for Amazon!
Try a bottle and get your favorites. My friends are addicted!
Pretty much the title says it. Might try Celebrations or Roses next year - we did all those when we lived there.... I believe this was the most economical when I looked this year.
These chocolates are the best but unfortunately they are not easy to find in the US as they are European. The product was very fresh and tasted amazing!

Thank you sooooo much for carrying this product. My wife and I recently spent a year in the United Kingdom and we both developed quite a sweet tooth for a number of products while there.
Her one main gift request for Christmas was a container of quality street. Thank you for helping to make her Christmas come true.
I would definitely recommend this seller.
Item arrived in great time even with massive snow delays before it even left the UK.
Thank you again.!!
5MM Pink Edible Pearls are a wonderful addition to cakes & cookies!  They can instantly add sophistication to any piece!
These are my favorite snack right now. Crunchy, tangy, a tiny bit hot... Altogether delicious. These are even better paired with a bag of pretzels!
I love Fizzies, and find them best, when broken into three or four pieces, then I put one piece in a glass of regular soda pop. which makes it fizzier! It's all about the fizz!

A diluted hot sauce derived from the jalapeño pepper. A 5 oz bottle is far too small given its diluted nature. You might use close to a bottle for a single family sized meal.

Ingredients (as listed, in this order, from the product label): Water, acetic acid, jalapeño peppers, carrots, sugar, ...etc

Tasting notes - diluted heat along with a heavy vinegar taste and, at best, a vague jalapeño flavor. The vinegar flavor dominates (acetic acid is a component of vinegar).

As noted in the title of my review - a below average hot sauce. I'd pass on this one. The vinegar taste is over powering. Note that the second ingredient (after water) is acetic acid (a chemical component of vinegar)!

I'd recommend the El Yucateco Hot Jalapeño Hot sauce which uses the same Jalapeño pepper but it has a much purer and fresher taste. I love the Jalapeño pepper but this sauce does not feature its fine qualities very well.

PS - As should be evident -- I enjoy taste testing hot sauces and writing up my results. I've tried about 50 different ones to date. I try very hard to describe flavor notes and list the actual ingredients.

I saw a bottle of this at my local grocer. I love jalapenos and seeing a red jalapeno sauce made it a must buy.

The sauce was not what I expected, I was expecting a thin vinegary kind of Mexican hot sauce. This sauce is much thicker than that, but not as thick as ketchup. It is a bit tangy with a balance of sweet and heat. The label says "Very Hot", but it will only seem this way to those who are more sensitive to heat than the average spicy food fan.

After my first taste the first thing that came to mind was hot wings. They have the perfect tangy/sweet/hot sort of flavor profile, along with a consistency that lends itself very well to sticking to wings (both cooked and raw). It is also thick enough to be brushed on wings while they are being cooked on a grill. I began to wonder if the brand name was called "Bufalo" because it was intended to be used for wings, but after some research I found out that the company name precedes Buffalo Wings by quite a long time, the name is pure coincidence.

As a wing sauce this stuff is a welcome addition. It is a very slight change from your standard hot wing flavor, being made with Jalapenos, while still very true to the flavor you expect from hot wings. As a hot sauce on its own it is good but each time I try it on something else I keep coming back to how much this tastes like a wing sauce.

I recommend giving this stuff a try to see what you think. Definitely try it on your next set of wings. My next bottle will be the larger sized bottle because I plan to make some more wings with this stuff.

If you are looking for a strong and robust cup of coffee, look no further.
Every time I brew a cup I get a reaction from people near by.
You can even run the same bag twice into one cup to get a slightly weaker cup of coffee....it's still eye opening however!
Brew On

This stuff is never cheap, but this is less expensive than the Flavia website and I really like this coffee.  When the Flavia machine breaks down I will not be ordering another as there are more varieties with a Keureg and the coffee can be found everywhere

I have used this product for years. It has lots of flavor and resembles and feels like real honey. The down-side of this product is the gas "problem" when you eat excess (???) amounts of it. I use it in place of Karo syrup to make almond-crusted pecan pies. It produces an "okay" pie. However, I eat large slices of this pecan pie and that causes the gas "problem". I bought bottles of Nature's Hollow and Natrazyle Kosher substitutes for side-by-side comparison with Honey Tree. Although neither caused a gas "problem", I believe both are lacking in flavor and the Natrazyle appeared to have a slimy "mouth-feel". I will try each of these in a pecan pie and if I believe either of the pies is better than the Honey Tree pie, I will report back.

Having been diagnosed diabetic I really miss all the heavy duty sweets to which I was accustomed.  My father and my husband were both beekeepers so I know what real honey should taste like.  This product definitely does not live up to anything resembling that taste.  True, it is sweet, and I must admit serves a purpose of sorts, but as for tasting anything like honey - no, it definitely does NOT.  I once made a 9x12 pan of baklava and ate all of it (except one small piece eaten by my husband) in 3-4 days - so, I know whereof I speak.

I noticed a difference between the quality of this matcha and a much more expensive variety.  I am currently a matcha neophyte but I noticed that the expensive matcha tasted significantly better, seemed more fresh, and had a better brighter color.  I use one heaping teaspoon per pint of hot water, and unfortunately with the more expensive variety it costs over five dollars per pint of matcha tea when you use this much.  Even so, if you can afford it, seek out the finer grades of matcha straight from Uji Japan.  The Uji region is famous for their fine Gyokuro tea and superior grades of matcha.  If you don't have that kind of money, this matcha could suffice, but try to get the Uji-based premium matchas, especially for special occasions.  This matcha is listed as being from Uji, but it isn't as good as the more expensive varieties from the same area.

I love this product.
I had a chance to drink green tea latte at Starbucks.
But, Starbucks green tea latte is very expensive.
So, I try to make green tea latte myself and I find out they use Matcha.
Everyday I made my own green tea latte for me and my wife.
She really likes it.
Fortunately, I found same product at local store with price $5.99.

Ujinotsuyu Matcha Hagoromo is not nearly as good as some of the other brands of matcha I tried. Instead of being a pure green, it had a faint yellow-brownish tinge. It was also quite harsh and bitter-flavored. If you're willing to spend more money but don't want expensive tea ceremony grade matcha, try Do Matcha 2nd Harvest (the red label variety). It has a much lighter and fresher flavor. My local store also carries Maeda-en, which is better than Ujinotsuyu but not as good as Do Matcha.

This tea is premium. Don't accept green tea in bags; it is less tasty and probably less healthy.

Here are just a few medical conditions in which drinking green tea is reputed to be helpful:

* cancer
* rheumatoid arthritis
* high cholesterol levels
* cariovascular disease
* infection
* impaired immune function
* acne, omg.

And drink four cups a day for the ultimate tea benefits!
I like using this matcha for latte smoothies and so far it has been yummy.  Saves me $$$ at the coffee shop, because now I make my own.

I found the matcha to be very bitter and grainy. I had few bowls but it ended up being used to cookies which were very tasty. Also made some smoothies with honey added and they were a hit.
I didnt buy from amazon. I got mine from a tea shop in chinatown for $5/can. I wanted to see if you really get what you pay for.
I have been buying my matcha directly from japan(yuuki-cha, ippodo,o-cha) and i dont think its fair to compare since they cost $20-30/can.
if you are looking for a serious drinking tasteful matcha stay away from this one. But as culinary grade matcha its certainly a good value.

When I received it and soon after opened it, the matcha appears a pale green, as if it has been sitting in storage too long before they sent it. DoMatcha, on the other hand, when I first bought it was bright green and fresher.

Not into this brand -- I prefer DoMatcha. . .

Being new to matcha, I bought two types to sample, this and the ingredient grade matcha from MatchaSource. I opened the MatchaSource one first and found it delicious, bright green, lovely flavour, dissolves well if you follow the instructions and dissolve in a little hot water before adding the milk. Then I tried this one, and was quite disappointed, the powder is sage green in colour, produces a grey-brown tea with very little flavour and the powder never quite dissolves.  Not at all what I was expecting given my experience with the MatchaSource tea. Between the two, this will not be the one that I buy again. Nice tin, though.

I made a cup of my usual..using preheated steamed frothed milk, this "maccha" green tea powder and sometimes a little Stevia. YUCK.

I paid $14.99 at an Asian store for this. The Eden $36 a can was much much much better...you can get that $27 or $29 a can in bulk. I've ordered some stuff from Japan..Ryu-Mei. I'll let you know how this works out when it arrives.

I guess if you just want to add powder to regular tea to make yourself feel better about the added health benefits this would be ok. If you hate the green twiggy matcha taste, this is ok.

This is probably ok as ingredient grade. Or if you like iced tea...

This is a sage green powder color ground very fine.
Tastes like ground BROWN tea. YUCK.
Nothing like the "Green" in Eden's Spring matcha.

The tin comes with a bag inside and a preservative (oxygen destroyer pack). You open the bag when you are ready to serve. Then dump the contents in the tin.

To each his own, this is not for me.

but the previous reviewer doesn't know that with his "jittery" comments.  He loves looking at what he writes on products he knows nothing about and doesn't even try.  Never helpful but allways full of himself, and all that for your pleasure!  All for the price of nothing.... and thats what its worth.

This was my first tea purchase for our Keurig machine, and I am very pleased. The flavor was smooth - no bitterness at all. Drank it hot, and over ice - both were fantastic. I will be buying this again.
We love this tea, especially when it's made into ice tea.  We just brew it over ice and presto!  You can add sweetener - or not.  It's a great summer drink.
I am not a HUGE tea fan, I'm a coffee drinker. But I do like green tea, and this is a nice and easy way to get green tea!

I purchased this tea along with several other kcup varieties for a coffee maker that gets occasional use. Unfortunatley, the expiration date on the Celestial Green Decaf Tea purchased here on Amazon is within one month. I know I will be throwing away most of this tea because it will expire before it is used. All the other kcups purchased have at least one year before they expire.

The shipping to return the tea would have cost half the price of the tea. I don't think I will purchase any more food items on Amazon.

I'm on the 17 Day diet and drink this tea at least 3 times a day. I love it. Perfect for the large cup size on th K. It's also one of the few decaf teas offered that doesn't have a funky taste. it's a staple for me. I highly recommend it.
I love these single serve cups, no steeping, so easy to use, would recommend to everyone. Very affordable, great tasting.

Celestial Seasonings has long been one of my favorite brands, and the caffeine-free green tea has a good, strong flavor.  I like it with a dab of honey. With the Keurig cups, it couldn't be easier to have a hot cup of tea in the afternoon.  Keurig isn't the least expensive way to go, for sure.  Much higher than tea bags.  But it makes a flavorful cup of whatever you brew - tea, coffee, mochas, cider. It's all good.
While I do love to shop on Amazon and do ( I love it too much ). The Kcups are less expensive on the Keurig web site. One of the very few things that cost less elsewhere.

I bought this for my dad as a gift, he loved it, and my parents said it was very pretty also. I like to give them gifts that they can nibble on, as they have about everything else one could imagine. Gifts like this one can at least be consumed. Good gift and glad to have this kind of option.

POP ROCKS 36 packs Strawberry Sold by candymachines/
Penguinmints Thru Amazon, & Free Super Saving Shipping...
They are so fresh & they Definitely pop great
in your mouth, & they taste great also.. YUM, YUM..Pop Rocks 36 Packs Strawberry

i have put more than a few gingerbread houses together with my kids and this was buy far the worst experience i have EVER had with one. do not waste your money on this pile of garbage. they use the Barbie name to draw you in and then nothing fits together, the directions are horrible and the house itself it tiny. from now on i will stick with a no name brand gingerbread house. my wife just left to buy a REAL GB house and i have just finished throwing this piece of garbage where it belongs....in the trash.

one good thing....the kids were are eating it, so its tasty.

One star is too generous. I love the tea and hate the seller. I ordered 6 packs of twining tea. The first seller I chose had a 6 pack and each pack with 20 bags. The next search was for the same deal and it even listed as a 6 pack. Now that I got the package I see it's one lousy box of 20 bags for more than $19. What an incredible rip off. Last time for Shaqdis Books and Marketplace for me.

I was most distressed when I discovered my local grocery store was no longer going to carry this tea; how was I going to get through my evenings without it? Then the light bulb went on & I thought "I'll get it from Amazon!" Shipping was very fast & now I have a good supply in my cupboard. When I run out, I know where it order it next time.

Since I am a teetotaler, I haven't tried this in the various cocktails where it is featured (just search the 'net for recipes). I love bitters in club soda. This product has a VERY intense lavender flavor, and I personally found that it was almost too floral to be drunk with soda. I did add some orange bitters and that helped. I think that these bitters will be perfect in cooking (I'm thinking lavender ice cream...) and perhaps as an herbal component, much like lavender in herbs de provence. If you love lavender you will very pleased. A little goes a long ways, so this bottle will last and last.

A few years ago we received a gift of salt someone brought us from Hawaii.  A beautiful salt that was a pink/beige color, a great texture and size, and lovely taste that enhanced all food.  It came in a baggie...sigh.  I've been looking to replace it ever since so I thought I'd try this salt.  My honest reaction about this salt - I don't get it.  I like the course texture of the salt.  It's a bit more chunky then we like though you do feel it when you eat.  The taste?  Here it is, I don't get it.  There is a critical mass point putting this salt on your food - and what we feel is that it's nothing or simply too much.  I know, I'm giving a lot of words here.  It's just that there are all these great reviews of how amazing it is.  The salt is kind of tasteless on the finger.  On food it seems to need a lot and then ICK!!!!  So my recommendation is a 3 because maybe we simply haven't found the exact amount to use to create the taste everyone is raving about.  I keep trying and it's either no taste at all or so over powering the food is awful.  For the price I'm tossing it in the garbage because it's too much a pain at meal time when I'm trying to figure it out.  I can't say it's awful because maybe it's us.  We are salt lovers and we buy and understand salt.  This salt?  I don't get it.  And that is actually saying something.  So I guess I'll take a stand and say - we don't like it.  I've tried it on simple and complex food and recipes.  Too risky when time is so busy these days to have to find a balance of the amount you use.  Going back to Morton's course kosher salt or our sea salt bought locally in Maine until I find that salt that matches the gift from Hawaii...

I've been using this red sea salt for a few years when i work (I'm a chef). The flavor is really bright and enhances quite a few dishes, from meats to veggies and even desserts. I decided to buy some for my home recently here. I find it is better used as a finisher, i.e.  sprinkled on foods. I also use it in seafood rubs quite often. My favorite uses are sprinkled on fresh veggies such as cucumber slices and heirloom tomatoes, on chocolate/caramel dishes, and used with seafood. I have several salts, so i generally use this for those three purposes, but sometimes, I'll add it to other dishes as well. It doesnt really dissolve quickly (probably due to the red clay which gives it its color), so it is better used in dishes where that isnt an expectation. Otherwise, it is multifunctional and i think you'll like it. Enjoy!

I bought this salt and the black lava salt for my husband, who is the chef in the family. Both are delicious, with different flavors that are appropriate in different settings. He's having a great time determining all those settings, and I'm having a great time tasting his results.

The salts came with a note from the company and a free sample of some candy; it was a very friendly and pleasant introduction to the company. They also arrived quickly, in plenty of time for the gift-giving occasion for which I needed them.

Im not sure what it should taste like, But I think it has a clay taste.

The kalua pig turned out great! which is why the salt was purchased.. Now the 3 stars comes due to amount of salt at such a high price. But try finding this at walmart!
I love the flavor of this beautiful, corally colored, sea salt. Another teriffic finishing salt what adds color and a light sea flavor to any dish.
I'll add another 5 star review!  I absolutely love this salt.  I even bring this salt with me when I go to restaurants (I have a small salt grinder).  BUY IT.

Alaea sea salt contains traces of red clay from the Hawaiian pools where it is condensed. That explains its color, its slowness to dissolve, and its flavor. I have no idea whether the clay adds any nutritional value to the salt, but it has a certain Biblical resonance. "Clay thou art, Adam!" In fact, the name 'adam' is derived from the Hebrew word for clay.

This is the only 'boutique' sea salt I've come upon that seems well worth the extra cost. It's extremely tasty on heirloom tomatoes. It looks appetizing on steaks and chops, sprinkled at the last moment before serving. It's something to reserve for "finishing" and "plating" food. A six-ounce jar will last a long time in most kitchens, so this is a decent value.

If you live in the South, you might try sprinkling alaea sea salt on the tail of the next ivory-billed woodpecker or Carolina parroquet you see, as a means of clearing the land for development.

This is the first and only hawaiian salt Ive ever tried cooking with so I gave it 4 stars because I dont have anything to compare it with. It was absolutely delicious though. I used it on some pork shoulder with liquid smoke and put it in the slow cooker for 20 hours. It came out amazing. Cant wait to try this on different recipes

These crackers taste very good. The only problem is I ordered it in mid Oct 2011 and it says on the package that the best before date is 02JAN2012... This is a pack of 6, and each box weights 8 oz crackers. I don't think I will be able to finish 6 boxes in 2 months...
Better than the non-organic store bought brand.  They are crisp and taste fresh.  I will buy this brand again and again.

This is an excellent tasting product.  Hooray for Nabisco for putting out an organic saltine!  The cracker is very similar to regular Saltines, only perhaps even better tasting, and I am happy feeding this to my kids.
Great tasting.  Kids love them and I don't have to worry that there are any genetically engineered ingredients.  A little pricey if you don't care if they are organic.

I regret to buy this here....The crackers are short-dated. I finally find somewhere online that sells it for less than $5/box. Don't buy it here.
But the cracker tasted good.
Very interesting product to get delivered directly to the house.  Uber-GOURMET fun to have.  But be warned --  it is not ALCOHOL free.  This is a fermented product.
I'm a soldier in Afghanistan, and there is nothing more fun than watching the expression in an Afghan child's face when they try Pop Rocks for the first time... The adults love them too!

Having ordered pop rocks for a group of students over a year ago, it seemed like a good idea to order the 36 pack for a new group this fall. The order was placed in early August. It is currently September and although I have written Amazon for resolution and they responded nicely, the order of pop rocks has yet to arrive. The rocks were needed for a fun way to introduce science lab books to a group of fifth graders. Do be careful from whom you order.

Pop Rocks are the best candies I've tried. Don't get me wrong, I'm italian, spanish, and german and I love these candy. When negative reviews come, don't listen to them. Try using these candies on soda. Don't hesistate; Just Buy it! I'm also a heavy metal person. Gift these to heavy metal people.
I tried this coffee in a Keurig and absolutely loved it.  I don't personally own a Keurig so I looked for it for my regular coffee maker.  I would definitely order it again.
I bought this hoping to use it for lemons and limes. Last night I needed to juice a lemon, so tried it out. It broke. Am going back to my tried-and-true glass juicer.

I tried this on a whim at a organic food store- it was so unbelievably good!  It was a total surprise and I ate it straight from the package.  The only problem I see with this product is portion control!  It is that good!
This coffee is on the mild side but a little too acidic for my tastes.  I will not order again.

I am really enjoying these preserves.  My southern mother-in-law used to make her own pear preserves and they were to die for.  The Blue Ridge ones are the closest to hers I've been able to find anywhere on the market.  Thank you very much for making such an excellent product.

This is very good honey, full of probiotics, and the taste is fantastic... only wish it was
a bit more affordable and glass jars would be nice.
Great for making Cuban Bagels. Make a cream cheese sandwich with fresh Cuban bread. Smush down and place under broiler, melt a little butter on top and sprinkle with Bagel spice. Yum!

Yep, this is A LOT of curry powder, but if you use it often in cooking, it really is a better price than paying several dollars for a tiny bottle (even McCormick's own tiny bottle) that'll be gone in no time - or worse, make you feel like you have to ration it. I like curry powder and for once in my life, I wanted to use it and not feel I must skimp. I paid just under $11 and in about a month, I've used maybe 3/4 of an ounce (I saved an empty 1 oz bottle to keep a more manageable portion on the spice rack). Like another reviewer said, it IS possible it tastes a bit different from the 1 oz version, but I couldn't say for certain, and moreover, I don't think it's bad - I'm using it, mainly on rice dishes. To me, it's legions better than Taste Specialty Foods Hot Curry Powder, 16-Ounce but not as good as Rajah Mild Madras Curry Powder 100g.

Google "curry powder health benefits" and you'll find plenty of results; it's best known for its benefits to digestion and for anti-inflammatory qualities, but also said to boost memory and protect against Alzheimer disease and cancer.

Ingredients: Coriander, Fenugreek, Turmeric, Cumin, Black Pepper, Bay Leaves, Celery seed, Nutmeg, Cloves, Onion, Red Pepper, Ginger.

The expiration, I'm pleased to note since there is so darn much of this(!), is April 2014.

I have tried at least a dozen different curry powders in the last several weeks and found that the McCormick 1 oz bottle is the very best by far.  Based on that, I purchased the 16-ounce bottle I saw on Amazon.  I was surprised when I found that the taste of the 16-ounce product was very different, to the point of not being able to use it.

It is seriously a bad taste.  No matter what we do, it tastes bad.  Bought the Orange and it is the most horrible taste.  Even when we put 1/2 a bottle in a gallon of orange juice, it takes bad, let alone when we put the whole bottle into the gallon mix of crystal light.  Do not waste your money.

I grabbed one of these at QT a few days ago, and have loved them ever since. As I'm writing this, they're unavailable on amazon, but I'm diligently checking as I'll be ordering a lot when they start selling them.

I use this as a light, high protein pre workout drink, and I love that it has caffeine as that really helps me push myself in my early morning workouts. I've tried milk+whey, but it was too heavy for me and always seemed to sit on my stomach and make me feel sluggish as I was trying to lift. I've also tried water+whey, but mannnn that tastes horrendous and I just have a hard time doing it. And neither of those have caffeine, which I think really helps to energize me. So far I've tried the grape and berry, and liked both. I haven't tried any of the other flavors.

This does taste a little tiny bit bitter at times, and definitely isn't as good tasting as a protein shake, but it's perfect otherwise. And you're not really drinking it for the taste anyways, are you? Grab one of these, lift a lot of heavy weight up and down as many times as you can, follow up with a post-workout shake, rest and repeat, and you'll get strong. Highly recommended!

Pretty good stuff for the money.  Very fragrant, nice aroma.  Only complaint is includes artificial as well as natural bergamot flavoring.  Eh, my palate is not discerning enough to note the difference, but I have to wonder ... why not all natural?

Love it! My favorite usage of this wonderful product is to add it to my morning porridge. For example, try semolina/yellow corn grits/cocoa butter chips or semolina/barley/cocoa butter chips. Of course you add the chips when the porridge is ready, you don't cook them. Enjoy!

I love chai and raspberries, put together they are heavenly.  Big Train makes many drinks that I like, and this is no exception, in fact this may be my favorite.  There is convenience in the single serving, and the price through Amazon is much better than I could get locally.

These don't have an appropriate texture to be called "cookies". The ingredients aren't blended well, so it feels more like a granola bar to me, and I've always hated granola bars (even when I was unaware of their harmful effects on human health). They also smell artificially, which interferes with the perception of their taste... although I can't tell if they have any taste, besides some sweetness. Where did orange, ginger, and chocolate go?

It's also irritating that the manufacturer doesn't talk about the ingredients in a simple and straightforward manner. Why say "low glycemic monosaccharide" and "low glycemic fruit concentrate"? Admit that it is FRUCTOSE. It is not enough to say "vegetable fiber". They are supposed to know exactly WHAT KIND of fiber they use, because it makes a difference.

They have a sweet and ever so slightly tart, cherry vanilla flavor. I really like the flavor, I just wish it were a tiny bit stronger.  I leave them in a jar for my kids to enjoy, especially after snacks and meals.  Guilt-free and good for your teeth.  All in all, a great lollipop with pretty, swirly colors too.
Not very sweet. Very bland, and in my opinion too expensive for the product. Flavorless, doesn't taste like you're having a treat but the amount of carbs is high.
The taste is like a bitter cherry. I don't like them but my kids do. Good be a little sweeter!
Great for babies learning to taste and enjoy food.  I never thought he would love vegetables so much.  He loves these!

The food is great and convenient to get it in an assorted pack but 18 pack means 9 PACKS OF 2. This is not a good deal and you can get these items for less as an individual purchase from almost any store.
Great for the price.  Don't bake too long or you won't have the runny lava center.  Very quick & easy & comes with it's own little pans.

This cake was a very rich chocolate in the middle.
It was the family's first lava cake.

So, if you love rich chocolate,
this is for you.

I am going to bake the next one
longer to please the family.

It is very quick & easy to do,
with a very good price!

I bought this only for an occasional
treat as we are attempting to eliminate
processed foods.

It just looked good, and it was!

I lost faith in my long time cat food, Science Diet, after the massive pet food recall.  Fromm claims this dry food is made in the US (Wisconsin) from meat, cheese and vegetables bought from local growers.  Quality meats, no glutens, fresh vegetables and human quality vitamins.  The cats like it.  It is more expensive than Science Diet, but not prohibitively so.  Note:  the Milwaukee newspaper advises the canned Fromm is made in China.  I have absolutely no faith in the Chinese quality and safety control standards so I would not buy the canned foods.

Although this is listed as a 5-lb (225 kg) bag, it is NOT.  It is only a 2.5 lb (1.1kg) bag.  Believe me, I very carefully checked the shipping weight in the description when I ordered it because it was a good price.  That has been changed in the few days since I placed the original order, however the main listing heading has not been changed. VERY misleading.

I've submitted this review once before, and it appears to have been deleted. Even odder, the description of the product has been changed to make it even more misleading.

This is NOT a 5 LB bag, it is a 2.5 LB bag, which means you're paying twice as much per ounce as you should. This is a comparable price for the 5 LB bag. The seller needs to change both the description and the picture, otherwise they're going to keep cheating customers.

All of that is a shame, really, because this is a very high quality food that my cats love. I recommend this kibble highly.

When did the rooster on the box get a cartoony face? Whatever happened to that wonderful abstraction? First they ruined Tony the Tiger, now this.

And where did all the high fructose corn syrup come from? Admittedly, it is a flake of corn but that is a nasty ingredient to be skipped at all costs.

It's things like that which drive people to the formerly odd grains like spelt and kamut!

Admittedly, I had a fever.

And I must say I am a devotee of the Corn Flake (though I only eat Trader Joe's Brand--Kellogg's flakes, though tasty, have too much crap in them).

But Cereal City--the true target of this review--and a place that now has GREAT bearing on my thoughts about this product--was CREEPY.

From the bald lady with two teeth who took our ticket and felt that this gave her liscense to engage us in a too-long conversation, to the Pennywise-looking clown that reeked of smoke--our first two minutes set the tone.

Throw in a weird new-agey film with floating balls of light that became speaking versions of dead historic figures who never got along in life and pick up their arguments right where they left off on the screen.

Add to that a poorly-lit animatronic Snap, Crackle, and Pop who end up either looking like they are rising from the grave or falling in worship at the feet of Tony the Tiger (depending on whether they are coming up or going back down).

Our (hopefully) unique experience involved not being able to find a lady crucial to our scavanger hunt for 45 minutes (did she go in back and take a nap?) I want a shirt that says "I waited 45 minutes to complete the Cereal City scavanger hunt and all I got was this crappy sippy cup."

Sadly there is much, much more...I could go on at length. But I won't.

The main point is that I get the sense that Kellogg's, as a company, is just as creepy as its tourist trap. Avoid both.

i was expecting this product to be like the picture and come in a small beer stein mug but it was plain jars of mustard. the mustard is fine but the picture is deceiving and i was buying the product for the glass beer stein as a present. not was i wanted.

The Fox's U-Bet Vanilla Syrup is great that I ordered.  The people I ordered from mixed the order up, and shipped the wrong quantity.  Even though I e-mailed them several times, they never got back to me at all.  So I still received the wrong order.

My husband absolutely loves vanilla egg creams but living in California, these are hard to come by!  With his birthday coming up, I wanted to surprise him with a genuine (vanilla) egg cream.  However, I had no idea how to make one!  So after doing a bunch of research  on all this, I found out it was essential to use UBet's Vanilla syrup.  Well, guess what, I did as recommended, followed the making of one down to the letter, and boy oh boy... not only was my husband thrilled, I now LOVE vanilla egg creams! This syrup is also great as a flavoring in sodas.  I highly recommend anyone to give it a try!

This is a good basic vanilla syrup. I have used it as a sweetener for coffee, and added it to sparkling water to make a respectable cream soda. The price is excellent, after comparing it to Torani and DaVinci syrups.

I'm on a low budget, a lot of it consisting of canned foods like campbells chunky firehouse hot and spicy chili. Like the other reviews available mentioned, it is NOT spicy by any real standards. For anyone who's been to a curry house chain restaurant, and ordered "hot" and not extra/super hot, you'll realize the definition of hot is rapidly changing to fit the more moderate group of individuals. If I'm really trying to save money that week, I just have a can a day. Half a can with rice, for lunch, and half a can with rice for dinner. I prefer to have it with long grain rice since its generally a bit dryer and goes better with the liquidy nature of the chili. I eat it with cheetos flaming hot chips, not the healthiest diet by any means, but it is a VERY cheap meal, and tastes great with the combination of things. What I like most about the chili is its high fiber content, I'm not one for eating a lot of vegetables, so the fiber in this really helps.
